Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jan50
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a grand little hotel. Very near the metro and only a 10 minute walk from Opera where we got the bus back to the airport. Check in was very easy, we were upgraded to a courtyard room when they found out our trip was my birthday treat. We were given a map of Paris with the hotel marked and the route to the major attractions. Our room was on the 3rd floor but there is a lift so no problem there. The room was quite small and the bathroom tiny but no worse than other hotels we have stayed in in France. It was very clean and the bed was comfy. The shower was fine with plenty of hot water. Soap and shampoo were provided as was a hairdryer and safe. There are loads of restaurants nearby, the hotel does provided breakfast, at an extra cost, but we didn't try that so can't comment on that. There is someone on duty at reception 24 hours so there is no problem if you are late getting back. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would stay again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ChristosK78
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a fairly priced hotel for our stay in Paris. We wanted to stay in the Montmartre area for our 4 night visit, and we stumbled upon Hotel Monte Carlo. The rooms are small but that shouldn't come as a surprise for visiting Paris. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Le Peletier Metro (2 minute walk). All in all the stay was very good. The staff was polite and helpful and the hotel is clean. They do offer breakfast at an added cost, which we did not try. The free wifi though came in very handy, and they can give you an access code for every person. The bathroom was very small and it is nearly impossible to have two people in that area at the same time. One thing two keep in mind, because of the room's size, if you are travelling with a big suitcase it may be a slight problem. We had two small suitcases so there was not a problem with the space, but had we had one or even two full size suitcases, then only one could be laying down open at any given time. But like I said, if you want a convenient location, a clean hotel, and you don't want to spend too much money then Hotel Monte Carlo will do you just fine! After all, how much time do you want to spend in your room when you are in Paris? :o)

Reviews.Title: “Central!”
Reviews.Author: Yesmin M
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 2 nights. Arrived very late by metro and the hotel was across the road. Very busy so felt safe with plenty on your doorstep-bars,restaurants,takeaways,convenience store. The hotel front door is locked at night and the receptionist is on duty 24hours so one has to ring the doorbell to be let in. My single room had a shower but no ensuite toilet hence had to use communal toilet which was a little disappointing. Free wifi but my code wouldn't connect to wifi so had to go to nearby restaurants to use wifi. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: boscommon
Reviews.Content: I came across this budget friendly hotel in Paris, one of the most expensive place in Europe. I stayed here for two nights and here are the pros and cons of the hotel: Pros: 1. Centrally located near Le Peletier metro station, about 10 min walk to Opera and shopping area on Rue Lafayette. Metro is literally 3 min walk from the hotel. 2. Budget friendly, this place is inexpensive, just book it from hotel's web site for deals. 3. Many places to eat and drink around, food choices from all over the world. 4. Room is very clean and spacious bathroom in European standards.' 5. Thomas at the front desk is very helpful for sightseeing tips and directions 6. Small hotel but charming with the unique decoration, simple and humble accommodation. 7. Hotel surrounding area is average, Banks with ATM near by. 8. Free wi-fi for all of your devices, excellent reception even on third floor. Cons: 1. The room is very small (and that is expected) and the twin bed is even smaller, probably the smallest one that I have even encountered traveling all over the world. So, if you can avoid getting the twin room. 2. The walls are super thin, so you hear everything, I mean everything and something are not meant to be heard in the middle of the night. 3. Skip the hotel breakfast, you can do much better for almost 9 Euro somewhere else. 4. Not sure why there is no shower curtain in the shower area (tiled shower), but the water is all over the floor and toilet seat. 5. There is no air con in the hotel, only fan and a small openable window. Verdict: If you are staying for a few nights (like myself), its adequate and inexpensive and friendly service. Its centrally located near a lot of different sight seeing spots and access to Roissy Bus at Opera to CDG airport. I would stay here again next time in Paris as it is a bargain for the budget traveler like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good! Good! Good!”
Reviews.Author: rolandho
Reviews.Content: The Metro (Le Peletier) is just 1 minute walk from the hotel and shopping area Lafayette is 10 minutes walk away! Next to the hotel you have the best Chinese noodle in whole Paris:-) The room is spacious, cozy & modern. The hotel reception is very helpful, provides us lots of useful information. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those on a small budget”
Reviews.Author: Kirsanie
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, good location, rooms very small but this is apparently normal in Paris and for how long your actually in them! Clean enough. Free wifi which is good. Missing a long mirror in the room (a bit annoying when getting ready and the only mirror is above the bed or bathroom sink). We tried breakfast on the first day but it's about 9€ for a very basic selection (no cheese, meat, eggs etc, better going to a local cafe. We didnt realise that when we booked through Expedia we booked a shared bathroom...not our cup of tea so we paid an extra 20€ a night to upgrade to an ensuite! Our room was facing the road, a little noisy and there is a few pubs along the road but we were too tired to be annoyed by this. Our room also had the lift right next to which was a bit noisy one of the nights but again this didn't bother us too much! All in all we thought this hotel was ideal for our short break!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, clean, polite and quite central”
Reviews.Author: thevontrapps
Reviews.Content: Saw the reviews on here and decided to go for it...hotel was as to be expected. It is a quirky little hotel at the bottom of the Montmarte hill, surrounded by places to eat and drink. Room was a little smaller than we thought but manageable. Room was very clean, which is in my book the most important thing. Overlooking the courtyard was quiet at night too. Staff were very friendly and helpful...and speak good English too if you are struggling in French. If you only in Paris for a few days then this will do the trick for you...and quite cheap by Parisian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 403!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicadee_12
Reviews.Content: Couple travelling together for a 3 night stay, hotel is situated in a nice area of Paris, good location. We have been to Paris many times previously but 1st time in this location. On arrival, greeted by a typically-natured French male receptionist, who refused to smile!!!! Allocated Room 403, fourth floor via very small but functional lift. Hotel is very clean, both rooms and communal areas. On entering our Room, where intially aware of a "communal shower area" situated directly beside same. Signage outside same states that it is not to be used between 11pm and .Didnt think much of it at the time, however, were made very aware of it use during the very early hours of the morning throughout our stay...... like 5.30am! As always, rooms in Paris are small and you can hear everything, so sounded like someone taking a shower on our bathroom at ridiuclous hours each morning. That combined with the road noise (there is a very popular Irish bar a few doors down from the hotel and revellers could be heard well into the wee hours from our Room) might make another court yard room better option. The Room itself was small, but as to be expected of Paris. It was clean and had adequate facilities (mini safe, hairdryer, fan, flat screen tv) for the rate. The bathroom was clean with a good shower however, the interior of the bathroom in general was a little tired, e'g mouldy ceiling in bathroom, main room was in better order, reasonably well decorated. Staff on reception the following day were exceptionally helpful and reccomended places to eat plus also booked a table for us at our chosen restaurant, which was greatly appreciated.it was just a shame our intial encounter on arrival was not as memorable. We would reccomend this hotel as it is quirky, also for its good location, easy access to the Metro, reasonable rate, but avoid Room 403! .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: amarat
Reviews.Content: Paris was our last stop on a backpacking trip. The front desk guy was the same guy the entire time. He was friendly and very accommodating when we needed a wine opener. They upgraded us to the "garden view" where we slept with our window open. Room was set up odd but great space for Paris. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nuitdepluie
Reviews.Content: It's a very minimalist, no-frills hotel with some design elements. Our room, Barcelona, was painted in red and had some bookshelf like storage space. There is not much room to store your suitcase but for a weekend it's more than ok. j The bathroom was clean but the walk-in shower was made in a way that the water would slightly flow into the bathroom area. The hotel is close to Le Pelletier Metro station and 20min walking distance to La Fayette/Printemps. There are several restaurants/bistros in the same street and a bagel place around the corner for breakfast. For Paris standards and prices, it was very good value compared to similar priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but leaves a little to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Gavin L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in late November, and it was a very minimalist, no-frills hotel. The room although clean and tidy, was extremely small and we had to move some of the furniture around to make more room for ourselves. Service was pretty average, and we were a little appalled that the hotel doesn't provide hot water to make tea/coffee in the room. Breakfast was blah, you can definitely get much better value and food in one of the many quaint Parisian cafes all around the city. Overall, the hotel was located in a safe neighborhood, with very convenient access to the metro. That is definitely a plus. I would recommend this place for people just looking for a clean and nice room to stay. However, if you expect more out of your stay in Paris, I wouldn't recommend this as the first choice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris for 8 days and 7 nights. We stayed at this hotel and it was very nice. The room is so clean and they clean up the room every single day when we went out in the morning. We had the attached bathroom and we just love it. We requested a room opposite the street, but they changed it to facing the garden. it was lovely. very quiet. it was that comfortable that we can just stay in all day :D the decoration is just nice. it's near to grands boulevard station, very convenient to get to other places. and the neighborhood is safe and not that scary :) lots of shops nearby. supermarkets, pharmacy, lots of patisserie, gifts shop. Definitely highly recommend this hotel. the service is superb. worth every penny we paid :D They speak english fluently. Definitely gonna stay here again if I go to Paris :D We had a lovely honeymoon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just steps from Metro station”
Reviews.Author: MachoTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Monte Carlo for three nights in May 2011. I booked a few months ahead of time, and was able to obtain a room with a bath on the second floor. The room was extremely clean, and the bed was very comfortable. It's in a nice neighborhood, and is safe even at 3AM. The room rate is a bargain, and there are no "surprises" at check-out time. A major benefit of booking a room here is the proximity of the hotel to a metro station. I only used the room to sleep, but they do have a nice flat-screen TV with access to a few English-language stations. They also have free wi-fi service, if you bring your laptop (but leave it home and enjoy Paris!) Finally, Paris is perhaps the most beautiful city in the world and the people are wonderful! Don't miss an opportunity to come here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Trample
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed here in November 2011 for six nights. The room was spotlessly cleaned, the hotel front desk staff was responsive and knowledgeable, and the location was terrific. A half hour walk to Sacre Coeur was easy and interesting. We also felt lucky to be on good subway lines; easy to get to the Gare de l'Est and the Louvre. We opted for an ensuite bath on the courtyard and slept like logs. When we come back, we're staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot, great value.”
Reviews.Author: jessz47
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue, but I stayed here twice within the span of a few months in winter/spring 2008. Rooms were quite small, but no one wants to be cooped up in a hotel in Paris anyway. They were certainly adequately clean, as was the hallway bathroom. I stayed once solo and once with a friend. Both times staff were friendly, and they remembered me three months after the first visit when I showed up. Fantastic location for access to many parts of the city and easy to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Aleone27
Reviews.Content: Good location in Montmartre that is not too touristy. The concierge was extremely kind and helpful. Rooms were cozy and quiet, perfect for our two night stay in Paris. We had a shared bathroom and it was fine. About a 20 minute walk to the Louvre, which is not bad at all considering the price and the fact that it's in PARIS, a city that literally eats your money. I would recommend this to a friend, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and clean place”
Reviews.Author: JVLam
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, since I travelled alone the room I stayed was just fine. It was clean and well located. But if you are going to Paris the first time, be cautious you get a proper map (detailed one). As the hotel is very close to Opera House, where the airport bus (Roissybus) main stop, if you get the proper map of Paris, it only takes 10 minutes walk. However, it took me 40 minutes to arrive at the hotel since I had to stop and asked people on the way. Many people did not know the area since many of them were tourists as well from other countries, they might not speak English. I was totally exhausted when I arrived the hotel. After shower, I was too excited to explore Paris almost the first time. I visited Paris some 30 years ago. I forgot everything about Paris. But it was a good trip and many things to see. Regards, JVLam

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: globalwanderer2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in Paris for two nights during a European whirlwind tour and stayed at the Monte Carlo while visiting. Here's the lowdown: Rooms - Expectantly small (as is typical of hotels in Europe) but spotlessly clean with a quirky style and fun decor. Having a room overlooking the street gave us a true feel of Parisian atmosphere. Reception/staff - friendly and very helpful. Being our first visit the Paris, the front desk was more than happy to assist us in planning our street walks and finding particular places. Location - Fantastic location located on a less busy side street very close to cafes and about a 25 minute walk from the Louvre. Once you get your bearings, Paris seems to get easier and easier to more you walk around. Breakfast - seemed a little pricey for what was being offered so opted not to take it and rather eat at one of the numerous cafes in the immediate area. Overall - Very much enjoyed our stay, and would definitely recommend it as one of the more affordable options for sightseeing in Paris. We loved the atmosphere, the Monte Carlo's unique style and had a generally positive experience all round. 4 well deserved rating points.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dan7482
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, walking distance to the Galleries Lafayette and the Opera, not too much further to the Louvre and the Champs E'lysees. A 2 second stumble to a Metro station, and there's a decent amount of restaurants in the area, though nothing IMO to write home about. Rooms are indeed colorful, and a bit small, but I was travelling solo so I didn't need too much. Free wi-fi a plus, albeit somewhat hard to access and was on the fritz at the time. I think I paid like E50 a night, which was very hard to find short of a hostel. A very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Manager”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1775
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days and 4 nights in Paris in May 2011 staying at the Hotel Monte Carlo. We arrived early in the day via the Eurostar from London. Mr. Thomas at the desk was just great when we arrived long before check-in time. He gave us a couple of suggestions of things to do in the area and stored our bags for us. We walked up to Sacre Coeur easily found with Mr. Thomas' directions. When we had taken a look around the church and area we headed back to the hotel. The room was all ready as promised. It was small, but certainly adequate for our needs. There was a small desk that was very handy for our laptop and the free internet that was included in the room price. Our room was on the street side so it was a bit noisy but it had a great view up and down Rue Faubourg, We enjoyed the people watching from the two large double windows in the room. If you need something quiet they also have rooms that face an interior courtyard. The next morning when we were about to head out for the day we asked Mr. Thomas how to get to our first destination and ended up with a whole itinerary for the day. It was just great. He was also more than happy to make dinner reservations for us and when we couldn't get one at the restaurant of our choice until a day later, he suggested a great restaurant just a block away. When we got there they asked if we had a reservation we said no but Mr.Thomas had sent us, They were more than happy to seat us. We did see other people turned away as they were quite busy. The food was very good as was the service. Mr. Thomas checked with us later to see how the dinner was. I can't say enough about how helpful all the staff were and especially Mr. Thomas. The hotel is very close to two metro lines and is within walking distance of many of Paris' sights. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ldvma
Reviews.Content: Small and cozy hotel that is very tastefully decorated. The rooms are small but still manage to care for your needs for hanging up your clothes, taking a shower and sleeping. It is very clean. For me and my husband it was perfect. We had a double bed, true I'd have preferred twin beds, facing the beautiful little courtyard. My friends had a double bed facing the street and one night it was a bit loud but otherwise fine. The breakfast room is so cute you don't want to leave. Outside the hotel you have a pharmacy, convenience store, restaurants, metro stops. The staff is really nice and helpful. The only drawback I can think of is that you sometimes can hear other loud guests ... but not the quiet ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location and free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a business trip and loved it. Great location, free wifi, plenty of restaurants and bakeries on your doorstep if you get hungry, there is even a small supermarket across the street. Rooms are small but unless you plan to stay inside all the time, who cares? Recommended if you want to come to Paris and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with great location and great price!”
Reviews.Author: JC C
Reviews.Content: First, yes, the rooms are small. The bathroom is small. But, after all, miss, this is France! If you aren't willing to be in a room that is best compared to a cruise ship cabin, you're going to be paying big money to stay in the city of Paris. So, level-set your expectations as far as room sizes...only the big "Americanized" hotels have the same size rooms that you expect for this amount of money in the US. That having been said, if you are a larger person (and I'll be happy to give specific measurement details via private message), you may have trouble in the bathroom. I am probably close to the largest that you could comfortably be to get in and out of the shower easily due to the very narrow entrance. The toilet and sink area was not a problem, though. Checking in was no problem. While I speak some French, I was able to switch to English with the desk staff. The lobby is nicely decorated, with several sitting areas. We opted to not get the breakfast because we were doing early morning departures and wanted to be able to eat on the go. The front desk mentioned the presence of a market nearby (practically across the street), and I will say that we stupidly did not take advantage of that. Go to that market and pick up some reasonably priced French wine as well as soda or other needs...it's much cheaper than buying at restaurants. You can also re-use smaller bottles as water bottles while you're touring. Also, if you're taking a train after (as we were), you can take wine or other beverages and snacks with you on the train and have a mini-picnic as you go. There's also several restaurants near the hotel, including pubs, a creperie, and a few cafes. One metro stop is very nearby and a few others are a short walk away. You can also take the RER line A (most often used for Disneyland Paris) from the Opera station, which is a short walk away (maybe 10 minutes, walking briskly). The room itself was clean and nicely decorated. It was very colorful without being garish. The lighting is a little dim at first, because of the use of CFLs, but it brightens as you leave it on. A fan was provided in the room, as well as a small LCD TV with remote. The window opens for cooling purposes. (There is a heating element but no air conditioning.) There were plenty of electrical outlets for our purposes, and wi-fi is included at no extra fee (but you will need to get a separate code/login for each device you plan to use). The wi-fi was perfectly usable for e-mail, blogging, podcasts, and photo uploads. We did not use it for streaming video at all, so I can't comment on that. The water pressure in the shower was fine, and shampoo and soap are provided, as well as plenty of towels. The sheets and bedspread were very comfortable. There's a safe in the room as well as plenty of shelves and area for your things. I definitely think the room size is comparable to a cruise ship cabin, in that there's just enough room and no more. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Izayla
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the advice of others who commented on Trip Adivsor and I was not disappointed. It was clean and in a safe neighborhood. The people are very helpful and speak english. The breakfast is good and at a fair price. It is in a great location, close to Gare Du Nord and three Metro stations. I had no trouble getting around. There are lots of restaurants and bars in the near vicinity. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay there again. Yes the rooms are small but who goes to Paris to stay in the hotel all the time? Everything I needed was provided, a clean bed, clean room, clean bathroom, security and the option of a convienent, fairly priced breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: DianaT247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo in Sept. 2011 and were very impressed - especially with the staff and Thomas. The hotel is located in the Opera District and was convenient to the Hop on Busses and Metro. The staff was excellent in providing any services we needed for our stay in Paris. The rooms are very small but clean - the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TracyOOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September. We arrived before check-in on a Saturday and were able to drop off our bags until check in. The staff was friendly enough, the rooms were small but from what I've heard, this is typical to europe. We thought the location was wonderful. We walked literally everywhere, however the metro is half a block away and easy to use. This is not a tourist area so Sunday morning was a bit quiet and challenging to find a bakery open however during the week this place is hussle and bustle. I reccomend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sahaScotland
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two nights at the end of August and it was very good. I read about it on Trip Advisor and I'm glad I chose it. It's a small hotel but close to the Metro and all the main attractions were within walking distance. We only used the Metro once. The staff were very friendly and helpful - on the first night there were heavy showers and as I was heading out the receptionist asked if I'd like an umbrella and then gave me a very expensive looking brolly! The room was fairly basic but very clean with a comfortable bed and a good en-suite. I like occasionally visiting Paris for long weekends and I'll certainly book in here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!””
Reviews.Author: Pesticu
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, the hotel is decorated simply but tastefully colorful. Each room is another city in the world. We stayed in room Tokyo. Room is not great, but very clean and overlooks the street. Within easy reach of any means of transport. I did not eat in the hotel, but around it there are plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galinarey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights. Location is in a great busy part of the city; lots of cafes, bakeries, restaurants and shops close by. Bus stations all around, metro and train stations within walking distance. Hotel staff were friendly, room was clean. Actual toilet was around the corner in the hall and actual shower was across the hall. Room had sink, TV, window, desk, bed, fan. We didn't eat breakfast there but went down the street and had a large selection of bakeries to choose from. There was a little market right in front of the hotel where we bought fresh grapes and 'la fermiere vanille' yogurt (best yogurt ever)! :-) We planned to explore the city most of the day, so didn't spend too much time inside the hotel. At night (around midnight or one) seemed like somebody would start cleaning, so the noise carried up to our floor. For the price, this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: alassandro
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in this small but elegant hotel in the Opera area. This two stars hotel is just what we were looking for: centraly located, impeccabely clean, well kept, well organised, honest and forthright. The hotel staff was quick ang eager to help with any projects and directions. We enjoyed our stay because we had everything we needed to be comfortable and safe. Wonderful for both tourists and business travellers. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelWishes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2011. First impression of the hotel is small but tiny and clean. Staff was very friendly and was able to answer all our questions and provide directions (with perfect English). We needed to get to an out-of-city area one night and was able to get the bus schedule printed at the front desk with detailed explanations on how to get there. Overall we had a great stay at Hotel Monte Carlo. Location: Good - within walking distances to two metro lines. There are also bus stops almost right outside of the hotel. Service: Excellent - front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Room: A bit small but clean and tidy. Only improvement I would suggest is to have some ventilation in the bathroom. Price: Very reasonable based on location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: EleesPerth
Reviews.Content: Decent location, cute little hotel, fairly basic but if you wont be spending much time in there its perfect. Rooms are fairly small so dont bring too much luggage. Front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty OK for the money!”
Reviews.Author: bugenhageniii
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the first week of July, 2011, and I mostly enjoyed my stay. The price was FANTASTIC, I felt, which was the primary reason I chose the hotel. I enjoyed the price, most of all, the easy access to the Metro, and the fact that I had a shower in my room, (no toilet, however.) That being said, you are somewhat in the middle of nowhere, as far as central Paris goes. It is a healthy walk to the river, as well as other landmarks. But, this is probably a contributing factor to the price! A comparable hotel in terms of creature comforts was, when I looked 30% more expensive. And, after all, you're in Paris! Enjoy the walk! A bad product of that, however, was that I got lost A LOT. There aren't any major landmarks that I could see to get my bearings, and I was frequently finding myself walking in the wrong direction. Certainly not the hotel's fault, but there you go. I enjoyed my room, which was adequately cool with the fan running, although it was on the warm side, (no AC.) The staff are reasonably friendly, although the African gentleman who greeted me kinda reminded me of the stereotypical Parisian who looks down their nose at crass American tourists! haha! But, again, it's Paris, and one has to more or less expect such behavior from time to time. He wasn't outright rude, but I did get that vibe. Might have been in my mind! What irritated me was the WIFI. I had to get a ticket for each device that needed access, and the ticket was only good for a certain time period. Also, the first two days I could get WIFI in my room, but after that I had to go down to the lobby. True, it's free, but I think a simple password would have been good enough. I did avoid the breakfast the first few days as it cost money, but I think it beat having to stand in line at another cafe wasting valuable time. Also, the few times I went to Starbucks a comparable meal always cost more money than what the hotel was charging. I'd recommend it the hotel's breakfast. But, overall, for budget travelers this hotel is perfect. They don't have the cats, anymore, however, which I was kinda looking forward to seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilJerz
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for those who want something different from your typical Marriott, Hilton,etc. Its in a great location. About two blocks from the Le Peltier Metro stop and about 4 blocks from the Cadet Metro Stop. The room all have names to the like Prague, Holland....etc. The rooms were nice and clean. A decent size for a couple. It has a flat screen tv in the room as well. The staff was excellent. Very helpful with looking for places to check out in Paris. There are tons of cafes, and restaurants in the neighborhood. We had a room that faced the courtyard...It was nice and quiet....I would definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, some parts of the accommodations are poor”
Reviews.Author: PBnJEurope2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for 3 nights. At first we marveled at how nice it was! But after more time there, a few things stuck out. Pros: -Close to metro stop (Peletier on #7) -Clean and up-do-date interior -Staff was helpful -Comfortable bed -Free wifi -Good tv -Neighborhood feels safe Cons: -Room was very dark all day, even with all the lamps on (only helpful when sleeping) -Low ceilings, particularly in the bathroom -No shower! Only a shower wand in the bathtub -Breakfast is extremely expensive -Healthy walk to main areas (15 minutes to Garnier opera house, 25 to Tuileries and Louvre, over 30 to the Marais and Notre Dame) Tips: If your stay in Paris is brief, this hotel will suit your needs well unless you prefer to be closer to the center. If your stay is more than 2 nights, I would suggest a different location as the bathroom becomes frustrating if you wish to stay clean. Also, do not get the breakfast, there are several bakeries and Starbucks nearby with less expensive options.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: innovationalist
Reviews.Content: Paris is expensive, this hotel is well located and value for the price. The rooms are tiny but lovely, I enjoyed one overlooking the inner courtyard. It is a shame other guests are not respectful of others - could we all please remember that other guests may not want to hear your plans at all hours of the day or night? This is an issue world-wide. Nevertheless, this hotel makes effort to minimise disruption and offers a pleasant experience, the owner/manager is very helpful with excellent English, a delightful person. I would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little budget hotel, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: PabloCuellar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rather small and cozy. my room was adequate and clean (this is most important). well lit, aired and quiet at nights. staff is friendly, and willing to help. breakfast is basic, and it costs 8 euro, so eat elsewhere. i was quite happy with the experience, It is a basic budget hotel, so don't expect anything special, but it offers a clean bed & bathroom to crash after an exhausting day of walking Paris. Also, i found the location to be convenient. Can't finish without mentioning a chinese restaurant right next to the hotel....looks not so good, but OH MY GOD! it was awesome!!, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Parisian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stano76
Reviews.Content: The service was excelent and the staff really made you feel welcome and glad to be in Paris. The room was really neat and clean. If you're looking for a big hotel chain expeience this hotel is not for you. If you're looking for a great little Paris experience in a clean Paris style hotel in a great neighborhood, this is it. The location is perfect. Fifteen minute walk to the Louve or the Opera House. The Metro stop La Peletier could not be any closer unless it was in the basement of the hotel! I can't decide weather we liked the location or the style of the hotel the most. The thing we liked least was no A/C, but that was not a huge deal because when the window is open we got a nice breeze and the staff put a fan in the room. Next time I plan a trip to Paris, I'll check them first before all others.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money...central area”
Reviews.Author: aybak
Reviews.Content: close to transportation..nothing fancy. smaller room..but over all good value

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great! We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: catherineweber123
Reviews.Content: Not stayed here before, but we'll definitely go back - this place is a gem, especially staff and location. It is in a great street with plenty of restaurants, cafes and shops. The local "passages" are delightful again with many cafes and gift boutiques. The Louvre and Montmartre is in easy walking distance ( 20 - 25 min ). The hotel is very close to two subway lines, a third one is not far as well. Our room was clean and light and airy and beautifully decorated, considering Parisian standards spacious. The bathroom had a large shower. The breakfast was a "petit dejeuner" with baguette, toast, muesli, all self service ( easy and sufficient). Most importantly, friendly and courteous staff! We found this hotel to be absolutely brilliant and you can even keep your luggage there on your departure date to spend more time in Paris before leaving. The Monte Carlo is a splendid little hotel in the heart of Paris. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Hoovacat
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay here in 2007. Possibly should have been alerted when we had to pay at check in. Room was awful - only powerpoint that worked had the tv plugged in to it. High up on a wall. Bathroom - bath was enclosed by two walls - had to climb in over the taps. Returned from a day in the crypt at St Denis to find radiators switched off - reception advised they wouldn't heat up until 8pm! As we had booked to see a show at 8pm at Folies this wasn't much help. Despite bookng form asking if you wanted a smoking or non smoking room we were advised that French law said all rooms had to be non smoking - when challenged as I knew this was wrong a gallic shrug! I had a cigarette thrown out of a window and landed on my head! TV appalling - pornography on most channels after 10pm. No international channels. Apparently some rooms have no ensuites just shared facilities. Always walk past it know and shudder"

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel highly recommended for fist timers”
Reviews.Author: Raucousrocker
Reviews.Content: Paris can be a confusing city for first timers, the location and value of the hotel is excellent for first timers and indeed everyone. The staff is very helpful. Also Tomas the owner is very courteous and friendly. Rooms are small as all European budget hotels but clean and comfy. In Paris you only come back to sleep. If you love walking, you can walk to Louvre, Orangerie, Orsay, Notre Dame from here though it is a longish walk. Le Peletier metro is 100 yards from hotel. Location and local help is the strength of this hotel. All in all a great experience. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a single female traveller - quiet, kitsch, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Cardiffgirl29
Reviews.Content: Area I spent 4 days in Paris as a sole traveller, and so was worried about getting a hotel that was in a safe area. Hotel Monte Carlo was perfect - literally seconds away from the Le Peletier metro station, and on a busy street so I never felt threatened walking around the area at night. Lots of restaurants and bars around the area too. Room I had a single en-suite room. The room appeared as though it had recently been renovated, and was exceptionally clean (and I've worked for a short while as a hotel cleaner while I was a student, so knew what to look for!) The deco was fun, kitsch and colourful. The room wasn't huge, but in Paris that's to be expected. Room amenities The bed was two singles pushed together. There was a tv with English channels, a safe (big enough to fit my laptop), a desk. No alarm clock though, but that wasn't a problem. En-suite bathroom had a cubicle shower, toilet and sink. Over-looking a courtyard The only fault I found with the room was that it was quite dark, but they provided plenty of lamps so it wasn't really a problem. Best thing was how QUIET the room was! I've had bad experiences before with noisy hotels, and was a bit worried when I saw how busy the area was - but I couldn't hear any traffic noise at all from the room! Staff Reception staff spoke English, and were friendly and helpful. Price I was happy with the price I've paid. Although you can find cheaper hotels in Paris, I was happy to pay the extra for peace of mind that it's in a safe area, and the fact that the staff were lovely and the room had everything I needed made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lucas_and_Nikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights recently, whilst in Paris to watch the French Open. We found the hotel to be exactly what we needed for our trip - everything was easy from start to finish. The location is great for anyone using the Eurostar into Paris - we walked and it took no more than 10 minutes. We chose the hotel primarily because of the proximity to the station and closeness to Sacre Coeur (which we didn't get to last time in Paris). That said, there are plenty of other Metro stations near by to get around Paris, and we walked almost everywhere to & from the hotel. The room was quite small but if, like us, you don't plan to spend your whole day there then it's ideal - bed was comfortable and bathroom tidy. The only downside is that the noise can carry quite easily so if you're looking for silence then it might not be for you. It's mostly dependant on your fellow occupants, but it certainly wasn't a big problem for us. Overall, if you're not looking for 5* luxury but want a great base to explore the city and have a good night's sleep, then this is everything you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: LopezMex
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us the best according the price. It was not so expensive, but still neither cheap. Rooms were not big, but very clean and we loved the stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great rates”
Reviews.Author: chris_from_singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights in mid-December 2010. The hotel has a nice and cosy feel to it although it might be a bit hard to spot on the street with its nondescript facade. I took the metro from Gare du Nord, having arrived from London on the Eurostar and was pleased to have found my way to the hotel in under half an hour (although navigating my luggage in the crowded metro trains was quite a challenge). The check-in was smooth, quick and easy although 1 thing I would add is that the front desk staff were efficient but they weren't all that friendly, on the 4 days that I was there. The hotel has a small lift but it probably makes more sense to walk up if your room is not too high up. The staircase and the corridors were generally dark for most parts of the day and it might be a bit unnerving if you come back late at night but it was fine for me. I was given a room on the 3rd floor, coincidentally, named Londres (or London) from where I just arrived from! The room is not big but its very cosy, nicely decorated with the theme of the city of which it is named. The room came with an LCD tv, an in-room safe, a proper luggage rack, a comfortable double bed (even though it was just me), a writing desk and a fan. The bathroom was neatly appointed as well, with a proper hot shower cubicle and cool red tiles. No complaints about the room except that it could get stuffy if the windows are closed at night but if u keep it open fully, the street noises and more importantly, the cold winter winds of Paris (it was below freezing when I was there) will likely disrupt an otherwise perfect sleep. The best part for me was the fact that the hotel felt safe, with card-key access and an in-room safe as well as the fact that there was free wifi! Only minor peeve was that the walls are quite thin so if you have rowdy neighbours who come back late at night, and if you're a light sleeper, it might be a bit disruptive but otherwise, no issues. Location-wise, it was about a 5mins walk to the Le Peletier metro station, which is 1 stop from the Galeries Lafayette, which is also a nice 12-15 minute walk away. Food-wise, I didn't book a room with breakfast but along the same row, you'll find a good authentic chinese restaurant, a japanese restaurant, a french cafe and the best part, a small grocery shop to stock up on anything from fruits, snacks to fresh produce. I'll definitely recommend this hotel if you manage to get a good price

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris for this price range & location”
Reviews.Author: SJC_NZ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in about a dozen Paris hotels in the same price range, with the plan to stop once I find one I like enough to keep going back to on future trips as I visit regularly - this is the one I've chosen! (have stayed twice, and just booked my third visit). - The staff are friendly, helpful, speak good English (and will upgrade your room if a better one happens to be unoccupied) - Breakfast is good quality & plentiful, excellent bread and croissants, nice cereal, etc. - Great location, 15 mins walk (or 6euro taxi) from Gare Du Nord station, lots of fun places to eat and drink, walking distance to most attractions, near 2 Metro stations - Rooms are quiet, even the street facing ones, and I've never heard another guest through the walls (very unusual for Paris!) - Rooms are bigger than a typical Paris hotel, and the bright coloured decor is great, you can tell they take pride in the place - Very clean, good quality towels & bedding - modern bathrooms, good showers (although on our first visit we had a bath with shower attachment that wasn't attached to the wall, you had to hold it - this would be my one and only complaint about the place), second visit had normal standing shower - quiet fans provided for hot days - free Wifi - Comfy beds, lots of space for suitcases, a safe is also provided, nice tv & furniture Paris is a hard place to get value for money in terms of hotels, so you really can't go wrong with this one. I've paid more than this, and got much less for it! Monte Carlo is well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jphnyc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. I had a small solo room with a twin bed, a small desk and flat screen TV. There was a wash basin and shower in my room and I shared a toilet down the hall. Very clean, very comfortable and very charming. The hotel's location is great as well - very near the Le Peletier Metro station. The Cadet and Grands Boulevards stations are close as well. Lots of cafes, restaurants and businesses around. My room was facing the back so I didn't have any problems with noise. The hotel is within a 15-minute walk of the Opera and the department stores on Haussmann Boulevard. It's a short hike up to Montmartre as well. I often walked home from the Marais in the evenings as well, and it wasn't too long of a distance (but then everything in Paris is theoretically within walking distance!) The people who worked here were very friendly, professional and nice as well. All this for 55 euros a night. Would definitely consider staying here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Montmarte”
Reviews.Author: WileyPost
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Monte Carlo last week. I was very pleased with our room that overlooked the street on the 2nd floor. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept very clean. The bathroom is extremely small, but everything worked fine. It was an easy walk to the Sacre Coeur. A bit further to the Louvre, Notre Dame and such. The staff was very helpful with advice on catching the train to Versailles and places to eat in the area. They have a breakfast room, but we didn't use it. Overall I thought this hotel was an excellent value factoring in the price, location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great! Recommend everyone to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarahc0
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my friend and had an amazing experience. Great value for money. It is a lovely and cosy little hotel right in the heart of Paris. Near many attractions that you can join walking : Louvre, Opera, Montmartre, Sacre Coeur... There are many cafes to sit and relax. There are also many great local casual restaurants nearby you can walk there and grab a good dinner. There is a supermarket and a pharmacy not far. It is also close to metro Le Peltier, only a few stops away from many Parisian attactions. Our room was uniquely designed, clean, modern, comfortable and had all the amenities required for 5 night stay. This area can be noisy most of the time, but we slept very well with our windows closed. The service at this hotel is impeccable, the staff are friendly. As neither me nor my friend speak French, they were very helpful in assisting us. We did not try the french breakfast, but it looked great. Great place! Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming with good location”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with a friend. We booked a twin room with en-suite and street view for our short trip. We arrived early at 11am but with check in at 3pm we left our luggage behind the desk and went off to see the city. The hotel was small at the entrance with a tiny reception area but was suitable to for the short trip. The staff were very friendly. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was suitable, although the en-suite was very small. So much so that the shower had no door/curtain and the water splashed all over the floor and door. Also we had to put the towels on a ledge over the toilet but every time we went to get one the hairdryer on the wall would fall off an start up! The beds were clean and there was enough sheets. The TV had a surprising amount of English speaking stations which was nice. As we were there for such a short time we only really used the room/hotel for sleeping. We ate out everyday. There was a lovely Pizzeria 1 block away which was lovely and had friendly staff. One downside I would say would be that I have a smart phone and was never informed that I would need a password to access the Wifi and therefore could not access the internet but for such a short stay it was not that much of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Small, yet functional with friendly staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: danb26
Reviews.Content: Great location and a lovely little double room (en suite) with view of a courtyard full of plants and a few china cats! Perfect for a quick break, Le Peletier metro just down the street and the metro is great for getting anywhere, all of the time! Some lovely little cafes around the area and don't forget to check out the Macarons of Arnaud Delmonte which is a 10 minute walk and well worth it. The only problem we think with this room would be how warm it might get in the summer BUT you can sleep easily with the windows open and there's a fan in the room, just in case. ALSO, we had a problem with the window but they fixed it - literally - immediately. This was pretty fantastic, to be honest! =)

Reviews.Title: “Small cosy hotel, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chArA1
Reviews.Content: we were there in the end of January for vacation. we had a very nice room facing the street and it wasnt noisy. we recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,comfortable hotel,with good service”
Reviews.Author: lixoudia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to Le Peletier metro station and many tourist attractions. With many options as shops,markets, cafes and pharmacy really close. The service was excellent with very helpful and English speaking stuff. Very clean with good heating, fresh sheets and towels every morning. What is more, we had free high-speed internet for 2 devices. When we needed a doctor they were very helpful, although we had to stay for plus half a day, because my friend was sick with high fever, and we paid for the whole day! Also, we had booked a room with street view and it was a little noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls, Cramped Rooms, Good Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: JzeroT1937
Reviews.Content: If this hotel bothered to remodel and focus on insulating the walls/floors, it would be a much better place to stay. I stayed in the "Amsterdam" room, one of the Double Bed rooms facing the small courtyard; by Parisian standards, the room is large, although living in New York in a cramped 3 bedroom apartment has jilted my notions of "large". If you're accustomed to spacious bedrooms and plenty of room to walk around in, Monte Carlo isn't for you. In place of a closet, you're provided with an open-face armoir and safe. The "double" bed (actually two singles pushed together) is placed sideways--this is necessary, as if it were placed straight it would rub against the armoir and desk (which is still too close for comfort, at the foot of the bed). In typical European form, the shower is a tiny cube with no door, so you'll waste several of the towels they place in-room soaking up the excess water that inevitably splashes all over the tile-floor bathroom, or possibly fall on your way back to the bathroom. But hey, I traveled to Paris on a budget, and could've done worse. The staff keeps the place pretty clean, replaces the amenities daily, and doesn't seem to go to work until around 10 AM, so they won't come barging in while your asleep. The front desk staff could be more accommodating--I arrived from my 9 hour night-time flight from New York in a Parisian snowstorm around 2 PM only to be told that check-in was at 3, my bags could be held, but I'd have to go wander the city aimlessly for another hour. After the flight, amidst a snowstorm, all I really wanted was a few hours of sleep, but apparently that was too much to ask from the Monte Carlo, because, as previously stated, check-in is at 3. The worst part of this hotel is the noise. Even facing the courtyard, I could hear everything going on in the hotel--coughing, showers running, the people from the "shared bathroom" rooms going to the restroom, doors slamming. If you don't have earplugs and are a light sleeper, you're not going to get much rest. Around the third night I invested in some earplugs and began drinking heavily at the bars to induce sleepiness in order to get over this hurdle--not exactly the "dream scenario" for a Parisian vacation. I had friends in the city I could stay with and catch a few hours of sleep after the holidays, but I'd imagine most travelers don't. The bottom line is, the Monte Carlo is a cramped, loud budget hotel that's kept sparkling clean. It's near the metro too, but few places aren't. If you can sleep through almost anything and don't mind a tiny room, the Monte Carlo may be for you, but at the price you pay, you could probably do better, and if you couldn't, pay a little more. You'll enjoy your vacation much more as a result.

Reviews.Title: “cozy hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janaFPOLIS
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel located in a beautiful parisian street with a metro line on the corner and lots of stores, restaurants, bars...close to many tourist attractions like the moulin rouge, montmartre, opera.. efficient english-speaking staff, very well decoreted colorful cozy confortable rooms with very good heating system, tv , big windows , nice views... the only thing i think they could improve is to add a few usefull accessories like bathroom towel holders.. the breakfast is reeeally good, especially the cereal/milk and croissants. my family and i will definitely stay at monte carlo when returning to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: asht0n31
Reviews.Content: Location is great close to everything. Very accessible to metro stations Peleteir and Grands boulevards. Many restautrants. A very nice supermarket chez Jean is next door. The room and bathroom are small to compare to american standards, but nicely and modernly designed. Also, it was extremely clean. We very much enjoyed the free wifi. Very freindly staff gave us help with directions and answer our queries. We felt lucky to find this hotel for our first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “horrable cold, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: gabruel
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 3nights in November. It was very cold, no heat. The radiator didn't work at all. And they said nothing until I informed it. Receptionist never said Sorry for my inconvinience. All they did was throwing a lousy blanket on my bed. Come and stay this hotel if you want to taste horrable cold of Paris in winter. Worst, worst, worst hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Occasiona_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide whether to give this hotel 3 stars or 4, but decided on 3 because the problem of noisy guests was a big one. Of course, the hotel can't be held directly responsible if guests stagger in at 3am, banging doors and shouting to each other. But because the hotel is so small and the walls paper thin, you get to hear *everything* that goes on around you. On the plus side, the staff were unfailingly helpful and polite, and spoke good English. The free wi-fi was great. The rooms were immaculate, though on the small side, as tends to be the case here. The bathroom was fine and the shower quite pleasant. November had a cold snap but the room was very well heated. So much so that we had to open the window occasionally. We didn't have the breakfast so I can't comment on that. Overall? A nice hotel but the noise will be a problem for many.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, English-speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: IC_EJ
Reviews.Content: Check-in and out went smoothly, the front desk let us put our bags behind the desk because the room wasn't ready when we got to the hotel in the morning. Then he gave us a map and directions to the sites we were going to that day- all in English. It was a quick walk from the train station and we never had to use a cab (but we prefer to walk most places). We reserved a room with a private bathroom/shower but I had to use the shared bathroom at one point and found it clean and private. We did not pay for the breakfast as there are lots of great places to get crepes in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a clean and frendly place that i'd be happy to return to”
Reviews.Author: loumcguinness
Reviews.Content: the staff were all friendly, and had no problem with giving directions or advice about where to go. i've never slept better in a hotel as usally i miss my own bed, but the room was very comfortable. the only thing that wasn't too good was the bath, i'm 5"4" and i couldn't fit into it! my hubby is over six foot so he found it quite difficult to wash! i was expecting meat and chesse for breakfast but it was really plain, but then again it was very cheap, still it wouldn't put me off staying there again as we all loved it! a lovely modern, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, hospitable, clean and colourful!”
Reviews.Author: 155019Susan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo is a colourful little gem. It is close to the Opera Garnier and the amazing belle epoque department store Galeries LaFayette (check out the domed stained-glass roof), as well as to interesting 'passages'--glass-roofed arcades filled with tiny shops and bistros. It is also handy to the Metro and is a nice walk up into the heart of Montmartre. The staff of the hotel are very personable and helpful, dispensing maps and advice. They suggested a wonderful little restaurant, Le Pre Cadet, nearby. The bedroom and bathroom were tiny but immaculate, and the decor is imaginative and done with artistic flair. No mass-produced neutral 'hotel style.' We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: AlZinSF
Reviews.Content: Although rooms are tight, they are spotless. This is a great value hotel, excelling in customer service and location. Steps from one Metro line; a block from another. Free wireless internet. Many interesting restaurants in this Montmartre area. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Paris's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sebax
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel, very central to all tourist attractions, bed comfortable warm shower and very helpful staff. Book early and get great prices. Worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Think again!”
Reviews.Author: RamiIsrael
Reviews.Content: Following "TripAdvisor" recommendations, we booked this hotel for 5 nights at late September. The first night was a nightmare, the room was linked to the elevator, and the elevator door was the noisiest ever. In addition someone planed the room's doors to slam Each time you open or close one. If you think that hotel doors should design to keep quiet as possible – think again! The next morning we asked the guy at the reception if it is possible to chance the room even for an extra pay. He was rude to us & suggested another room for 3 nights only for the price of €180! The official price for double room at this hotel is €123, he told us that the price rise up! We checked the internet that day only to find that there was no change in the hotel prices. The room was lovely painted & decorated, but with minimum fought about usability. In the bathroom there was no place to hang the towels, while sitting on the toilette was verbally sitting under the sink. The room had some open space to storage clothes, can't call it a closet since no doors were installed, this era was not given light from any source! In order to find something we had to bring the table lamp in front of this "closet". If you think that a hotel room should allow you to storage your clothes & be able to see what you are wearing – think again. On checking out, the owner was very nice & offer us coffee urging us to tell him how was our stay. The minute we told him the story about the exaggerated price…he start to attacked us as we didn't understand what we have been told & it can't be, you must be wrong… If you think that the customer is always right – think again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: samyeoh25
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and we were glad to stay at the Hotel Monte Carlo. Both Thomas and Olivier were extremely helpful and made us felt at home. The hotel is located near the metro and the surrounding is full of restaurants, café, etc. We will definitely be back again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jamaes22
Reviews.Content: Located at the bottom of Montmartre this was truly an amazing location. We walked everywhere from here....15 minute walk to Sacre Coeur, 15 minute walk to the Louvre. The staff was very helpful, especially with arranging transportation. The hotel is very clean and quiet at night. The rooms are a bit small and some of the rooms do not have a bathroom en suite [rather it is shared with about 5 other rooms]. At first we were not happy about this, but it ended up being no problem at all. There was a sink and mirror right in the room which made it less of a hassle to have the bathrooms outside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good localization. No air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: childo
Reviews.Content: Very clean and good localization. The rooms are small. But, if you just wat a place to sleep, that´s a good choice. I booked the hotel by the internet, from Brazil, using my credit card, and every thing was right. Wi Fi free!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iparis
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel Paris should be proud of. Well done. Cute, Cozy, and Super CLEAN! The helpful user friendly management set the benchmark for customer service and excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Great value cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Damian_arg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for 4 nights in a room with shared bathroom. First of all, for the money, this is probably the best value you'll get in Paris. Our room (number 410) was located in the fourth floor and it was of a decent size. Even though we didn't have AC, we definitely didn't have any problems with the temperature since we could leave the windows opened and it was fairly cold outside. Btw, our windows faced the back of the hotel so we didn't have the street noise other reviewers complained about. We got to peak into other rooms, and some of them were really tiny though. The service was excellent. Either Thomas or Olivier were really helpful every time we needed something. The hotel offers free wifi (encrypted so you have to ask for the password) and free coffee and/or tea. The only thing we found slightly disappointing was the breakfast. We read some good reviews about it, so our first morning we decided to try it. It consisted of coffee or tea (that's free as I noted earlier), orange juice, croissants, bread, and little containers of butter, nutella, and jams. There were no eggs, fruits, yogurt or anything fancy, and it costs 8 euros. I found it really expensive to pay close to 10 dollars for a croissant that you can buy on the street for 1 euro. Other than that, we'd definitely recommend this place for any traveler that expects a great value on a short budget. This is not a five star hotel, but a boutique hotel that offers a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “we had a very nice stay in Hotel Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: EggsandInk
Reviews.Content: Clean room, good beds, simple small room, but tastefully decorated. The bathroom in our room was low (about 1.83m high). The breakfast was very simple (bread and croissants were ok, but no cheese or ham, marmelades only). A very nice but simple hotel, nearby a subway-station (and near Galerie Lafayette). Very helpfull friendly staff, speaking English. Absolutely good value for money. Next time when we visit Paris: Hotel Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “For budget travelers only - good location”
Reviews.Author: satori00
Reviews.Content: PROS: The location here is excellent and very convenient for taking Roissy Bus to the airport. The staff were very professional and pleasant. There is an elevator which is nice. CONS: Room is very bare bones. No air conditioning and opening the window lets in a ton of noise from a very busy street. The bed was not very comfortable and the walls are very thin - I was awoken by noise from other guests in the hall. I had a shared bathroom setup which was ok but someone used the toilet and did not flush. It is not the hotel's fault but just be aware you may have to deal with some disgusting things. If you are looking for a budget hotel I'd search harder as I believe you can get a better value elsewhere - I stayed in another hotel (La Maison Montparnasse) for the same or less and its room was much more spacious, new, clean and renovated, and with a private bathroom. (The location was less convenient though).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Rip Off/Ask You to Pay More and More And Not Refund the Money You Already Paid if You Decide to Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CRock999
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness- Room smelled like rotten milk. Location- Average/not the best, but atleast had a metro. Rooms- small and could barely walk around the beds. No A/C, poor wifi connection (verified with 3 lap tops) Sleep Quality- like i said the room reeked of rotten milk especially with no AC, That means the window had to be open.... Could barely sleep that night. SERVICE AND VALUE: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE Here's the story: We booked this hotel for 3 nights in paris. My girlfriend and mom were traveling with me. We all checked in at the same time. Through orbitz, we booked the room with a private bathroom, but the man at the reception said that our booking did not indicate a private bathroom and if we wanted one we would have to pay an additional 90Euro surcharge on top of our rooms that we already paid 220 euros for. We didn't really have a choice so we paid, brought our baggages upstairs, and went out for the night. We got back to the hotel around 2:30am and were getting ready for bed at around 3 am when we got continuous phone calls from the reception desk. The guy who checked us in earlier with 3 people calls us and tells me that the room is only for 2 people and one of us must leave or pay 129 euros to upgrade to a 3 person room. I try to explain to him that he should have told us this in the beginning when it was during normal business hours so we can find a new place to stay. We definitely booked a room for 3 people it was becoming so much of a hassle at 3 am with no where to go. The next day we talk to the man at the reception and his "colleague" who we later find out was the owner. They are still not budging about the the reservation. My Orbitz reservation even said 3 people on it, but they insisted that was impossible because orbitz does not book for 3 people. I then sought to compromise with them and explained to them that they should first credit me the 90 Euros for the first upgrade for a private bath. They were still insisting that I pay the additional 129 euros. So i told them I will just move hotels and please refund me the money for the nights I did not stay. Now they tell me that there are no refunds and I must leave if I am with 3 people. This was a huge inconvenience, not just moving hotels, but being stuck with almost $500 of charges that I had to dispute with my credit card once i got home. I later found out that this "colleague" understood me the entire time, but pretended she only spoke French. DO NOT STAY. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. WE WASTED HALF A DAY SWITCHING HOTELS AND TRYING TO FIGURE OUT A SOLUTION.

Reviews.Title: “90% of excellence!”
Reviews.Author: CedricDeBoom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel (two double rooms) for a weekend in august after reading incredible reviews on this website. The hotel was indeed wonderful: small, but cosy, modern and a warm atmosphere from both the interior and the friendly, helpful staff. The rooms were very well-cared-for and clean, and despite the limited dimensions, it gave us all the space we needed. Breakfast is sober and simple - croissants, toast, jam, chocolate spread, cornflakes, orange juice, coffee, tea - and doesn't quite compensate it's price. If you book a room at the street side and sleep with your window open, it sometimes can become noisy; but a large fan is supplied in every room, so we could sleep with the windows closed, hearing absolutely nothing of the outside. We did miss a small refrigerator in the room however, but that's just a detail. The hotel is very well located, near two metro stops, but the street - especially around Boulebard Montmartre - is very crowded in the evening. There are some nice restaurants only a few blocks away (e.g. Vaudeville, Les Noces de Jeanette...) and loads of shopping facilities on the boulevards. In short, excellent hotel for a short and extremely nice stay in a city at least just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Staff - Great Value - No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug35
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this quaint little hotel in Montmartre. The location is an easy walk from the Le Pelletier Metro station and you can reach all of Paris from the Metro. The price (for Paris) is excellent. We made an economical choice of a room with a shower (extra) and another without. The rooms are tiny. The first room overlooked the street and we enjoyed the view of a side street in Paris. There are excellent small mom and pop restaurants everywhere near the hotel. We took the RER train from Charles De Gaulle airport to Gare du Nord. Rather than take the train and walk up and down stairways with our bags, we rolled our bags and walked to the hotel from Gare du Nord - a good 20-30 minute walk. The hotel has an elevator that takes two people and one bag and we had a third floor room. At night we found that the hotel supplied fans (there was no A/C) were noisy and we could not get sleep. We exchanged the fan in the middle of the night with the night manager. The next day when we returned from our travels we found that they had put a new fan into the room. Nevertheless, (coming from a soft life in the US with AC) the 90+ degree temperature outside was oppressive and we cracked the windows open only to have the noise and light from the street keep us awake. The location of the hotel is superb and the value for money is tremendous. If you are on a tight budget and want to be close to the action you cannot go wrong - Just don't choose one of the hottest days in July to come here and stay. We took the Metro and then walked to Notre Dame, Tuilieries, Louvre, Jardin du Luxembourg, along the Seine, to the Shakespeare and Company Store, to the Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe as the Champs Elysses. The Metro gets a little scary later at night and there were a lot of people sleeping off the street at the entrance to buildings. The hotel offers free internet - which we used - and one cup of coffee in the morning - which we did not know about until the day we departed. We had some delicious crepes in the restaurant kitty corner from the hotel. Everything in Paris is more expensive than the US especially food items. We found a great bakery close to the Poissoniere metro stop by walking up from the hotel. Great prices on croissants and freshly baked stuff washed down with a cup of ... (Nescafe)! An early morning checkout at 5:30am and we walked to Gare du Nord. There is something unearthly and beautiful about Paris so early in the morning. Unfortunately the automatic machines dispensing RER tickets for the train to CDG would not take my US visa (no smart chip) nor my large Euro notes. Trying to come up with 35 Euros in small change was impossible and we had to wait till the counter opened at 7:00 am to get a human being to sell us tickets. Our advice if you are taking early morning trains and relying on automated dispensers is - take plenty of change!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: VEK_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo 4 nights in July. The hotel is very well-maintained, nice and clean, colorful rooms with bathrooms to match. Our room was Barcelone, our friends had the Oslo-room in the 3rd floor above us. We didn't have much of a view, Oslo offered a view of the roofs. Both were very quiet at night. The lack of air-conditinioning could be a problem if it were hot but during our stay the temperature was about 24 Centigrades so the floor fan was sufficient when you kept the window opened. The staff ( especially the family running the hotel) was very kind and helpful. Free coffee was nice in the morning, we didn't have the breakfast (would have been 8 euros extra). The location is excellent: 3, actually 4 metro stops near by. We used Mobilis-cards (6.10 euros per day for free travel) and took usually metro from either the La Peletier (nearest) or Grands Boulevards station, depending on where we were going to. Lots of nice restaurants nearby, would recommend La Peninsule for their lunch buffet (I think it was 13 euros all you can eat, they charge extra if you don't eat everything)..

Reviews.Title: “Good if you just want a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: PoseidonLee
Reviews.Content: It's my first time in Paris, only stayed 2 nights. I heard rooms are tiny in paris ... never really understand that until I open the door to my room. Tiny room, but managed to fit in a bathroom, tv and a place to hang your clothings. Room is very clean, desk staffs are friendly and helpful. Did not take breakfast which can be had for another 8euro, anyway down the street are some nice place to eat breakfast. TV programs in rooms has wide language selection. Location is not bad, a lot of restaurant nearby, quite nice and busy on friday nite. It's walking distant to Montmatre, but it's not near and it's up slope all the way, probably in excess of 30-45mins. Just take a bus along the street. Metro station is just nearby as well. Metro is very easy to use in Paris once you are use to it. Just look out for pickpockets ... especially do not be too happy if you see a group of young teens gals crowding and speaking loudly around you ... it's time to bash your way out. Paris is a must visit for all the famous and fantastic monuments! Monte carlo is a place you can consider, at least the nite is not too noisy. Only that it's too warm even with the fan in summer. haha.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly and helpful owner/staff.”
Reviews.Author: jpscoffee
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Decor is very nice and the rooms are inviting and comfortable. Size is fairly big compared to some hotels I've been to in Paris/London. Friendly staff/owners and very helpful. Thomas speaks English well, the others passable. The only downside for me was that I like to sleep in as cool a room as possible and it was a bit stuffy/warm (we had to shut the window). The fan also is a timer fan so after two hours if you want it on you have to turn the dial again. In spite of all that, I got a good nights sleep. My wife and I always travel with earplugs and used them here. Not that it was terrible loud (the soundproof windows works well), but the occasional loud truck or other noise can wake you up. Great location, convenient to anything (like all of Paris via Metro). Also, the Turkish restaurant across the street is excellent! Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Warm - too warm!”
Reviews.Author: JohnG327
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with personal service from staff and owner Tomas. Easy to get around city using Metro station Pelletier. Grocery and restaurants nearby on street. Printemps and Galleries Lafayette are within walking distance. Hot in Paris and noisy street made for some sleep problems (no air con)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expectation”
Reviews.Author: tbhuruth
Reviews.Content: Booked this small hotel online 2 weeks before reaching there. Had some doubts abt quality and cleaniness as well as hospitality. But this hotel was marvelous. Staffs were very kind and helpful (unlike the usual french guys!) The single room was not as small as seen online. If you are travelling solo and wish to spend a good night sleep in a clean hotel, go 4 Monte Carlo. Many good restaurants and pubs just near by. Ideally located. Eiffel tower is just 45mins walking distance (I've done it). Champ elysee is closer. Cons will be that: . there is no restaurant in the hotel. But was not needed sine many close by. pick n choose. . No saloon where you can sit and chat with other people in the hotel. But Paris is out there why would I want to sit in the hotel! . No smoking in rooms (I am a smoker so this is a con for me) . Quite small bath room, but can cope with.

Reviews.Title: “Base Camp, Paris”
Reviews.Author: UpperHolocene
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant room. Fantastic, friendly, knowledgeable staff. Excellent location. (Great noodle restaurant next door) Easy walk to 1st arrondissement but close to the Metro. No air conditioning- the room has a fan, but Paris seems to be getting hotter summers every year. Complimentary coffee (not breakfast) which is almost mandatory for me to get the day started.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, small rooms, better than London hotels”
Reviews.Author: Hip17
Reviews.Content: Friendly place with a central location. Room was tiny (but palatial compared to similar London hotels!) - the small desk in the room had a chair that could only be pulled out six inches due to the bed. The nearest metro station is on a line (no. 8) that doesn't seem to connect conveniently to anything, but a 10 minute walk takes to you more connected metro lines. 15 minutes to walk to Gare du Nord. Wireless internet worked but was a bit wonky. Neighborhood is great for restaurants, cheap eats, etc. Yes its noise, but one doesn't go to Paris for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerky
