Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Paris at the Hotel Monte Carlo. It was especially meaningful that the owner was on site. He gave us great recommendations and was very helpful. Remember this is a two star hotel and, as such, was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: gigi54025
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip wonderful. The staff spoke English & were very helpful w/maps & info on Paris. Very helpful since it w/our first time there. The first morning we went to breakfast in their lovely downstairs room ( so Paris feel ) small & quiet. I asked if they had croissants & the woman brought some out from the back. The next morning they were out of them & I was fine w/that. A few minutes later I noticed the woman had left & when she returned she had a bag of fresh ones. She didnt say a word but just put them out. This really was over & above. Our room had a comfy bed & they were cleaned daily. In fact, the whole place is very clean & quiet. Regards from Mario & Gladys in San Francisco,Ca.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: PPLondon0
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the basis of the excellent ratings given by previous customers and was not disappointed! I was very impressed by the hotel's individual style, it is quirkily decorated throughout and the warm colours used create a cosy and inviting atmosphere. I loved my stay here. For those travelling by Eurostar the hotel has very good transport links to the Gare du Nord and to the very heart of Paris. Sacre Coeur is also nearby. I was also impressed by the amazing service I received, from the warm welcome to, in particular, Thomas' kindness and helpful assistance when towards the end of my stay I discovered to my horror that my purse had been stolen whilst I was either on the street or on the metro. I found the Hotel Monte Carlo to be a real gem and fantastic value for money. I highly recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: amberm88
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a very warm afternoon - only to find out our room did not have air-conditioning. Not even a fan! We were on the 2nd floor and had to open the windows to get cool. The shower was dark, had no area to place toiletries, and flooded easily. The hotel was a short walk away from the Le Peletier metro stop, and was across the street from a small grocery store. There were several restaurants nearby. There was no "do not disturb" sign in the room. Our only encounter with the staff was with a woman who did not speak English very well. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again if it had air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely affordable accommodation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ErikaZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monte Carlo is a conveniently situated and very sweet little hotel. The rooms are small but very clean, and tastefully decorated. We spent most of our time outdoors exploring Paris and surrounds and this hotel offered the perfect affordable accommodation solution for our stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful. A very good experience indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: ExPensiveWino65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I unexpectedly stayed here as 'refugees' from the volcanic ash cloud. Thomas and the staff could not have been more helpful as we sorted thru the confusion of getting back to the US. The coffee served at breakfast is also excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Jillby2000
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations and was very pleased. Only thing I didn't like was that I traveled with a friend, we each paid the same price for a single room/shared bathroom and somehow she got a larger room with a shower. Why did we pay the same? (Of course it was great to use her shower instead of the shared one down the hall). Otherwise it was very, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonEeMouse
Reviews.Content: Good location hotel with a boutique-type feel but without adding an addition premium for being more 'chic' than average. Our room had an adorable bathroom up a few steps from the room and was very cosy with a very comfortable bed. Good location. Only fault would be that there seemed to be lots of stairs - probably not all that disabled-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in Montmartre district.”
Reviews.Author: BookedUp4You
Reviews.Content: On 20 March, 2010, four of us checked in for 4 days/3 nights. We had 2 rooms, one with a shared bath and the second ensuite. Shared bathroom had the courtyard view while ensuite had the street view. For the money we paid for the rooms, we will stay there every future trip to Paris. Although there are other reviews and comments on the friendliness of the staff, we want to emphasize these comments may be understating their helpfulness! We felt as though we were being treated like major guests in a very upscale hotel here in the USA. And, to be upfront, as we observed the staff interact with other guests, they all received comparable service. So, we don't feel we received special treatment, just receiving what the staff normally does for all of their guests. As an example: The first night, Cheruse (male staff deskman, spelling of his name is probably incorrect: My fault for not being more diligent) made suggestions about where to go for dinner. Many desk clerks do this at hotels; however, he took extra effort to be accurate with his directions and with his recommendations. We felt he was giving us useful information, personalized to our family, not simply making standard recommendations to everyday tourists. A second example: In the evening, we would bring in pastries from the local bakeries and wanted to sit in the small lobby while we socialized and relived our day exploring Paris. The staff members would bring us clean dishes, cups and silverware to use as we enjoyed our pastries. Without being asked, they simply made the effort to help us! This is a boutique hotel; the rooms are not going to be large and expansive. The rooms are meant to be used as a place to keep your luggage safe and a place for you to sleep at the end of your day. We felt very safe in this hotel; never once giving a thought to whether our belongings would be there when we returned. We were only a 20 minute walk from The Louvre; a 5 minute walk from the Opera House, and 10 minute walk from Sacre Coeur Basilica. If you wish to use the underground, there is Le Peletier station about 5 minutes away. A third example of special attention was when Tomas offered to arrange a shuttle for us to get to Charles De Gaulle airport on the morning we were to leave Paris. The night before we were to leave, he called a service and negotiated for us a flat rate of E60 for the four of us and our luggage. When the taxi arrived promptly at 9:00 am the next morning, the driver claimed not to know about the negotiated arrangement. Tomas stood up for us and contacted the dispatcher to resolve the misunderstanding. When we arrived at CDG airport, the driver only expected to receive the agreed upon E60. Yes, we did tip him, too! Re-reading this review, I genuinely feel as though I am leaving out more of the special attention we received at Monte Carlo Hotel. If I have, I offer my sincere apology to the staff and owners. Based on our stay, we all four wish we could offer the most glowing recommendation possible. Other than the recommendation for this hotel, we also strongly suggest first time visitors to Paris take the "red bus" tour. It cost us E24 each, but you have two days with unlimited use of their tour buses. You can get off at any of their stops and then board another tour bus which arrives approximately every 15 minutes. We were able to visit all of the major tourist destinations without ever needing a taxi or the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff - we will return.”
Reviews.Author: brandybubs
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's good reviews and it was a great choice. It is cozy and personal and the helpfulness of everyone (especially Thomas the owner) was second to none. It is well placed to visit all the sights either on foot or by Metro and surprisingly quiet considering the buzzing area it is in. Our room wasn't big but adequate and the bathroom was tiny but everything was spotlessly clean and perfectly suitable for our 3 day break. We will certainly use this hotel again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I Had The Time Of My Life!”
Reviews.Author: happymom2008
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong at Hotel Monte Carlo, in the heart of the 9e. Upgraded to a courtyard view room. Really nice artwork from a local artist. Statues and paintings of cats abound. Great full sized bed with plenty of room, I slept like a baby for four nights. Lots of hot water and great water pressure. Electronic safe in room and a flat screen TV. Key cards on the doors made me feel safe. Curtains on the soundproof windows made great sleeping at night. Nice continental breakfast for 8 euros available. Three English channels (CNN, BBC, BBC 4), French, Italian, Spanish and Russian channels as well. This is a small family run hotel that deserves more stars. Tomas, the owner was fantastic with directions to sights and the use of the Metro. Great places to eat and shop in the area as well. Just a very short walk to several Metro stations. Housekeeping was good as well. Tomas arranged a shuttle to Orly for my return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel for budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Shan0991
Reviews.Content: For the price they are charging in Paris, it's worth the stay. Free internet is available. Room is small but still with some space for lugguage. If you are not planning to stay in the room the whole day it should not be a big problem. Bathroom is simple but warm water is adequate. Locatioon is in Opera area, 5 mins from tram station. Easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're on budget”
Reviews.Author: VCBK26
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the rooms were decently sized, and the staff was nice. All three things were what we were looking for in Paris. As young couple on a budget, it we wanted to see Paris, but not loose an arm and a leg to the visit. The location is adequate, but in Paris you can get anywhere by Metro! I think the best part about this place is the value! It's a nice, clean, safe place to stay while you're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2057
Reviews.Content: It is a cosy and homey hotel near Opera in a safe area of Paris. The room and bathroom were spotless and well maintained. During our stay it was cold outside, more than - 5 degrees, but the room was very warm and a good hot shower. A good point for the hotel. All in all we loved this hotel because of its location, comfort, cleaness and helpful staff. We would recommend it to everybody and will keep the adress for the next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but pretty average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikkin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend after reading recommendations on this site. The plus points: Location is fabulous, lots of cafes, restaurants and bars along the street and within walking distance. We walked or cycled everywhere (hire a velib - they're so easy and convienient!). Between 2 metro stations so easy to get around if you want to use the metro. The receptionist during the day was friendly and gave me directions etc. About 15/20mins walk from Gare du Nord so easy access for the Eurostar (or take a bus - you have to change if you take the metro). Or a 5/10min taxi ride was about 8euros. Free wi-fi all throughout the hotel. The negative points: There's no proper door in the bathroom and no shower curtain so each time we took a shower, the whole room would be flooded and we'd have to put towels down and mop up afterwards. It was ridiculous - shoes, bags etc all had to be moved off the floor before showering. We had a serious delay on the Eurostar and ended up arriving at 5.30am in the morning! Despite informing them of our arrival time that night and being told that they have a 24hr reception, when we arrived at the hotel, extremely tired from our Eurostar ordeal, the front door was locked and the lights were off. We spent the next 20mins phoning and ringing the doorbell before someone eventually heard us and opened the door! Very annoying. If you happen to have a room overlooking the main street, it can be extremely noisy. There are late night bars/restaurants opposite the hotel including a very rowdy Irish bar with live music! All in all, I wouldn't stay here again - we paid 100euros per night and in my opinion, although this isn't excessive in Paris terms, there are better hotels out there for that price. Sadly we booked late so all the better hotels were all booked up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient, Great hotel for Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: TWAlan
Reviews.Content: It's a nice clean hotel located conveniently in Monmarte and is 2 mins walk to metro station (Le Petier). The room is small but is quiet and confortable. I have to share restroom and bathroom with people in the same floor but the restroom and bathroom and kept clean so I don't have any problem it. The surrounding area is quiet and looks pretty safe at night and close to numerous restaurants and bars. 10 mins metro ride to Louvre, Sacred Heart, and Notre Dame. Highly recommend this hotel for budget traveler or solo traveler. Thomas at the front desk is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Our choice for next time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Janek81
Reviews.Content: We paid cca 90 euros for double room with windows looking backyard - as the street looks a bit busy and I think it was really worthy. The room was very small, but we don't need anything more. One double bed, table and chair, television, working "!!!!" heating, safe for your valuables, wardrobe. We missed a small fridge, but you can't have just everything, can you? Bathroom and room as well were more than just acceptably clean and bathroom was of "normal" size (not the mini one you are maybe used to while visiting Paris). Walls thin, so you can literally hear nearly everything around - little bit annoying early in the morning, but you can find this in any "cheap" hotel in Paris, at least that's what I think. Staff was friendly - nothing more, nothing less. When we asked for anything, they helped us, but otherwise they didn't really care about us - and we appreciated that (no interviews on how was your day how did you like Paris etc., just polite Bon soir, Bon Jour) Area around the hotel looks very nice, about three minutes walking, there is really busy street with lot of restaurants, some theatres and clubs as well I think. From hotel one minute walk to metro (station Le Peletier) and about 15 minutes walking to Louvre. Just be careful, when you come back at night - everytime we had a problem in finding the right street with hotel - as there are so many same small street on same junctions :) Maybe it was just our problem. At the end: We really liked our stay in hotel Monte Carlo and next time we come to Paris we will probably stay here, again. Thank you, Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2-Star in the Ninth”
Reviews.Author: BullwinkleJMoose
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny (but this is Paris), the bathroom tiled in an odd brown, the lobby practically non-existent, the walls a bit thin, but we highly enjoyed our stay in this friendly 2-star hotel. The young man behind the counter (Thomas?) was very friendly and knowledgeable about Paris and happy to give guidance to his guests. The room was spotless. Ours was on the courtyard and we had no street noise. Skip the overpriced breakfast, nip around the corner to a patisserie, and enjoy back at the hotel in the "lobby", where a pot of coffee awaits for free. Good deal for 89 euros/night.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, nice sized room.”
Reviews.Author: MoOsEBoT88
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night, despite paying for two (delayed flight). The hotel was clean and tidy in both the rooms and in the reception, staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was basic, toast or cereal with a selection of hot or cold drinks but was at a surprised cost, which was not advertised? Toilet and Shower are shared with everyone else on the floor, I counted 8 rooms on my floor, though the toilet and shower were clean. There was a wash basin in my room though. Only one plug in the room for charging my phone but discovered an adapter in the desk drawer later. Also saw a hair dryer and air con, again need to be plugged in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Safe area, Near major sites.”
Reviews.Author: qwfgergrtg
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Would recommend this to anyone. Our room very clean. Wifi worked fine in family room. Rooms compact but think this normal for this class of hotel. Family room fine for 2 adults and a ten year old. Central location to all major sites with added advantage of being between two metro lines for choice of routes. Large multicultural choice of cuisine nearby (also junk food McDonald's etc if you want it) . Small supermarket and several bakers nearby. No on site parking (par for the course in Paris)but owner helpful in locating secure garaged parking 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant stay with few areas of improvement”
Reviews.Author: Cndw0rldtravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in October and was overall pleased with my stay. The hotel is centrally located, within a 10 minute walk to the Opera / Galleries Lafayette, and roughly 20 minute walk to the Louvre. Many restaurants, cafes and bakeries are located nearby. Le Peletier metro station is just around the corner which is also a huge advantage. The owner of the hotel is amazing and goes out of his way to make you feel welcome. The rooms are tiny but this is Paris, and should be expected. I stayed in a single room with a shared bathroom and was initially a little apprehensive with the idea of having to share a bathroom. This was not a problem at all as the bathroom was also vacant when I needed it. This hotel is extremely clean!!! There's also free WiFi which I used every day and it worked well. Couple cons that i'm hoping the management of the hotel will read and take into consideration. 1) The shower on the 4th floor has a very STRONG, unpleasant moldy smell that literally made me cough and made me nauseous. I'm not sure if it's mold or something else, but the smell is quite strong and can't be good for one's health. 2) The night staff was very unhelpful & unfriendly. I needed help a couple of times with directions or help with the metro system, and the gentlemen came across as bothered and unwilling to help. 3) You cannot check in before 3pm even if your room has been cleaned and is ready to be occupied. While most hotels do allow guests to check in at an earlier time assuming the room has been cleaned and is vacant, management of this hotel doesn't seem to be flexibile around their check in policy. Again, I am overall pleased with my stay at this hotel and i've already recommended to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms, creepy-old furniture”
Reviews.Author: Filippo75
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the good part: the hotel is located in Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, in a very nice neighborhood full of restaurants and cafes. I paid 110 euro for a single room, a price not excessive considering how expensive are hotel rooms in Paris. Rooms are really tiny: the single room can barely contain the bed and a small table; don't even expect a wardrobe: my room only had a small niche in the wall were you can put your clothes. Furniture (very minimal: bed, 2 stools, a chair and a table) were really really old. In summary: tiny rooms are mostly the rule in Paris or London, if you are traveling on budget; however, I think one should expect a room with a more modern decor for that price level

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and well situated”
Reviews.Author: ChicaPlaya
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights on my way through Paris to Ireland. I am a solo traveler and am most concerned about affordability balanced with a clean, safe and convenient location. I got it all at this hotel. The staff spoke enough English to help me check in and find my way around the city. It was right around the corner from the Metro and a short walk to the airport bus stop at the Opera (although just long enough that next time I'll take a taxi with my heavy bags!). I felt safe here and was pleased with the number of food and cafe options nearby. My only compaints were that it was a bit noisy inside the hotel with loud doors slamming and in summer it would have been too stuffy with the windows closed and too noisy with them open. But that said, I'm back in Paris for two nights next week and booking there again. Definitely good value for money and a secure place to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good situation, for people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: MimiLoveArt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo is a great little hotel with really friendly staff who are extremely helpful. Thomas (sp?) on reception was excellent giving directions to anywhere we wanted to go and was very polite when we tried to use our very poor French, replying in excellent English! The 8 Euro breakfast buffet was extremely good - the best coffee and croissants we have tasted in a long while. The hotel was well situated to walk to either Le Peletier or Grand Boulevard metro stations but we only used these twice prefering to walk everywhere. Gallerie La Fayette is just 10 minutes away as is the Opera house and Saint Lazare station. There was only one initial worry for us - that we had to share a shower and toilet with the other rooms on the floor. We very quickly realised that this wasn't too much of a problem as both were very clean. All in all this hotel is great for budget travellers. I think it is very suitable for singles/couples for a weekend break. (It was late September and unseasonably warm and there is no air conditioning as far as I know for those of you that like that.) There are also plenty of little supermarkets and food outlets in the same street as the hotel to grab snacks and drinks. I would use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, decent value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Worldbutterfly
Reviews.Content: We booked the Monte Carlo at the last minute and didn't know what to expect, other than the reviews we read here. We were relieved when it turned out to be a very comfortable and clean hotel located in a calmer area of lower Montmartre. Sacre Coeur and several cute pedestrian-only streets are easily walkable, and the central museum/Seine area isn't much further. (We walked everywhere but there are also several Metro stops nearby.) The manager is friendly and the rooms, while very small (of course), were comfortable and appeared to be recently renovated. Everything had a clean, well-maintained feel. Hot water was plentiful, and wi-fi was dependable, speedy and free. We skipped the 8 euro breakfast in the morning and found ample choices at nearby bakeries and sandwich shops. Of course, we wished it were cheaper, but this is Paris, after all. We would stay here again and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aqlbob
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is conveniently located for the Metro stations Le Peletier and Notre-Dame de-Lorette on lines 7 and 12. Our room, although small, was clean and well decorated in modern colours with a slate floor. The en-suite bathroom, although small, had a very good sized shower. There was no air conditioning but a fan was available and the window opened very wide. Surprise features included free Wi-Fi and a laptop sized safe. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a small supermarket opposite which was useful for supplies such as drinks and snacks. We enjoyed many activities which we would recommend. We prebooked a tour of Paris on Segways which was great fun and allowed us to see lots of sights - citysegwaytours.com. We also prebooked a river sight seeing cruise which saved several Euros at vedettesdupontneuf.com. Trips up the Eiffel Tower take several hours, instead go up the Montparnasse Tower which used to be Europe's tallest tower at 209m where you can enjoy a panoramic view from the 56th floor and go up to the helipad. The catacombs were fascinating but be patient with the queue since numbers are limited - they shut the doors at 16:00 prompt so do not bother joining a long queue after two or three o'clock. Many tourist attractions are shut on Mondays so plan for this - we headed for the Jardin des Tuileries and took a long lunch in the shade of trees at La Terrasse de Pomone. This is much better than dining in busy streets with a lot of noisy traffic; and they do an excellent sparkling Crémant de Loire which is much better value than overpriced Champagne. Eating in restaurants can be expensive so instead of "a la carte" look out for set menus "plat du jour" which are often very good value for money, and many still offer choices for each course. These are available both for lunch and evening dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rerabbitskiing
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this charming hotel. the staff were very friendly, and helpful when needed. the room was clean and tidy and looked recently decorated, and in general the hotel looks like there is someone who really cares how it looks. it is quirky with the colours etc which we liked. the breakfast was very good, and the coffee perked us up for more wandering around Paris. The hotel is is also in a good location with a metro station close by that takes you straight to the louvre and the shops, you can walk to the big department stores and there are a couple of cafes nearby and a good restaurant that was open very late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skipper84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for 3 nights. The location was quite good, there are three tube stations surrounding the hotel - very close to Galleries Lafayette. Staff were very helpful whenever we had any questions. Rooms are small but clean. There was no air conditioning but we opened the windows and there wasn't much noise at all (our room was towards the back of the hotel). Hallway & lift area smells a little funny and no cats (much to our disappointment). Supermarket across the road, lots of bars and restaurants surrounding the hotel. Very close to station if you're catching the eurostar. Overall a very good hotel if you're on a budget. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spend great time in paris”
Reviews.Author: mandana12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real good find; I have stayed there 6 nights with my friend. The family that runs the hotel does so with such warmth and kindness, which makes you, feel right at home. We received excellent directions every single day and were always given helpful tips, which made all the difference. The location is super convenient, steps away from two different Metro stops with great cafes and restaurants and the room was very clean and attractive. I will definitely stay again and have recommended to friends, this is an excellent place with a good a price.

Reviews.Title: “I think u can find better”
Reviews.Author: FADI1981
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights, it was clean and staff were helpful but with no Air conditioning which was a problem for us, becuase if u think to open the window, then forget about sleeping from the outside noise. rooms were too small, hardly u can move inside the room. location is very good and just 1 minute walk from the station and lot of shops, restaurants, bars are around.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much what I had hoped for, which is good...”
Reviews.Author: gladium
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room, without shared bath facility since it was cheaper and from the reviews, it seemed safe enough. On arrival and throughout the 5 days/4 nights I stayed, the staff were friendly and helpful. My single, located on the top floor, was comfortably petite with a window facing out on the street. The windows could be safely opened without any noise filtering in from the streets, which was needed on some nights as the room has no air-conditioning. Only a heater and a fan. Wifi was most useful, as I had brought a laptop along. Always felt safe in the hotel, and walking along the side street from the Le Peletier station (about 3-minutes away) back at night. From the station, one can easily Just opposite the hotel is a small supermarket, which one can get milk, water etc from. Also tried out 2 of the eateries - a bistro on the corner of the main street and a Chinese noodle joint just a few doors away from the hotel. Tasty and reasonably-priced. Overall a pleasant stay...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and close to metro stop”
Reviews.Author: Coloradofamily7158
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was a decent value for the price. It was very close to a metro station (line 7) and there was a small grocery store across the street. We needed a room for three people and there were two normal size twins and then one smaller bed. The bathroom was larger than we had expected and there was a small elevator that we only used during check in and check out. We passed on the breakfast at the hotel and bought our breakfast at a little coffee shop across the street with great coffee and fresh pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: missharris
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my boyfriend recently for a 4 day trip to Paris. We are both at university so therefore, we needed a decent hotel on a budget, and the Hotel Monte Carlo was perfect for this. We spent 3 nights there and the service was good. The hotel staff were very friendly, answering any questions that we had and spoke very good English. The rooms are quite small but that didn't bother us as we were out most of the time but it was always cleaned by the time we got back. Our room faced the street and it was very quiet at night, which was unexpected. The hotel is also in an excellent location. There was a nice patisserie in the same street where we had breakfast each morning. This was a lot cheaper than the breakfast that the hotel provides for 8 euros but I can't comment on the quality of the hotel's breakfast because we didn't try it. We also came across a small restaurant called La Creperie, which only served crepes but they were delicious! It was in a small alley off of Boulevard Montmartre, approx 5-10 min walk from the hotel. Worth visiting if you want to try some good crepes! We walked everywhere in Paris, so due to the location of the hotel we didn't need to use the metro or buses and saw a lot more of Paris by walking. The hotel is only a 20 minute walk from the Gare du Nord and was easy to find. It is currently undergoing redecoration but this didn't cause any problems for us. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel, especially if you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jbiketourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our 2 night stay in Paris. The room was very clean and attractive. A large window opened out to the street. Breakfast was great and we loved the small, family run, feel to the place. I would recommend this hotel for an inexpensive to stay, but next time I come to Paris I plan to stay in a more interesting neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, better than most 3 star, really warm & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: schmitddubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real good find, I have stayed in a few 3 star hotels in the same area of Paris and my stay here was far more enjoyable. The staff were really friendly, they seemed genuinely happy to see you and remembered your name and which language you spoke. I didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that unfortunately. The location is really good, you are 30 seconds walk from Le Peletier station and there are shops and restaurants just outside the hotel. It is probably as far out as I'd want to go but it still doesn't take long to get to most places, probably only 30 minutes maximum. The main reason its only 2 Star is the shared bathrooms but they're fine. They seem to have an army of cleaners ready throughout the day and when a bathroom is used its usually cleaned straight after. The bathrooms are clean, new and tidy and you only share with a few other guests. I will definitely stay again and have recommended to friends, this is a excellent cheap place to stay. There aren't many facilities but it is 2 star and its better than most three star hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like described”
Reviews.Author: Sam007LA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its’ good reviews for an inexpensive, centrally-located, Paris hotel and we are very happy with our choice for a 2* hotel in Paris. The location is convenient for shopping and eating at restaurants. It's about 5-10 min walk from Haussman district, the big street with Opera, Galeries Lafayette and Printemps (shopping area). Metro stop lepeltier (pink line n° 7) is 2 minutes walk away from the hotel. We are pleased to report that the positive online reviews about the hotel are consistent with what we experienced during our stay. It’s a nice comfortable and clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff that we would definitely recommend and keep in mind for our next stay in Paris .

Reviews.Title: “Very SMALL and weird”
Reviews.Author: Parislover14
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there one night and I'm really happy it wasn't more than that because i couldn't stand more. The room was clean but extremely small. We had to carry our 3 huge suitcases to the 5th floor as the elevator wasn't working and we had room next to the shared bathroom so the "smell" and noises were coming in to the room. The door in our bathroom didnt close so there was no privacy- Very romantic! I wouldnt stay there again even for the price of free Wi-Fi or little bit lower rate. You can add $30-$40 and you'll have a much nicer and bigger room. You dont go to Paris every month so its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HeadCougar
Reviews.Content: I didnt expect much, and have been warned Paris is very expensive wherever you stay so i chose Hotel Monte Carlo due to its location and cost. The rooms are small (but then again what isnt !!) in Europe ifyour on a budget and i had share bathroom facilities, but all in all i really enjoyed staying in this hotel and the bathrooms were spotless. The host spoke reasonable english and was very helpful getting me started in Paris. WOuld recommend as a budget style stay in a safe, funky area of Paris and right opposite the station and a very close walk or train ride to the main station to jump on the eurostar !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great find!”
Reviews.Author: U2nyd
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel. The staff is incredible - thoughtful, friendly, well informed. In addition, they speak English quite well! We were upgraded to a room with a better location upon arrival (less noisy). They even held our luggage for hours between checking out and catching our night train. The staff also helped us get our bearings and gave us great directions and tips on where to go and what to do in Paris. The room was small but very well kept up. We even had a flat screen TV. The bathroom was large (especially the shower) compared to some European hotel bathrooms I've seen. Also, the free Wifi is great. Much better than the 12 euro per day wifi we had in Rome! The location of the hotel is fairly good. The street the hotel is on also has some good restaurants and eateries, including 2 or 3 good crepe makers. There are two subway stations close by: Grands Boulevard and Le Peletie (sp?). The Gare Nord train station is about 1.5 miles away. In addition, there is a small museum nearby that sells Paris Museum passes. The hotel does offer breakfast for 8 euros per person. We never tried it since you can get a decent breakfast on the street for 2-4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eloise_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for a traveller on a budget. The rooms are bright and clean, a lovely simple breakfast and the location is great - I walked almost everywhere, but otherwise the metro is very close. I was pleasantly surprised on arrival to discover I had been given a room with a bathroom, even though I had booked a more simple option. The best thing about the hotel however was the service. The people on the front desk were incredibly helpful and friendly - even drawing maps with detailed instructions for getting wherever I wanted to go. Highly recommended for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Owner, Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this well-situated small hotel and took a break in the middle to train to London. From the moment we walked into the colorful, cozy lobby and received a cheerful greeting, we knew we had found our new favorite Paris hotel. If you love the Grands Boulevards area of Paris, this hotel is ideal. Because we split our stay, we were able to enjoy two different rooms. The size of each was about average for a hotel of this price in Paris, but both had bathrooms that were surprisingly spacious and equipped with large stand-up showers. The decor is very stylish with walls and tile in shades of purple, gold and aqua. Our beds were comfortably made up with spotless white linen. The windows of our second room opened out to a lushly planted garden tucked in between the surrounding buildings. The owner explained that this had been a dreary spot, but that he had envisioned a beautiful view for guests and so had hauled plants down a ladder from the roof to create this lovely garden. Make sure to enquire about the cat statues and paintings placed in the garden and throughout the common areas of the hotel. The story is quite romantic. Breakfast was ample and fresh and served in a pleasant room adorned with paintings done by the owner's wife. The service in this hotel was exemplary. We asked to leave some bags behind when we took our quick trip to London and our request was handled very nicely. Our requests for directions to a self-serve laundry were answered with a carefully drawn map and the taxi on our departure day was waiting for us as promised. The in-room Wi-fi had a strong signal and unlike many hotels in France, it seemed to be a secure network. There are many good restaurants on this street and around the block on Rue de Lafayette. This will definitely be our home away from home on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: heliosadithya
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at this hotel. The room was comfortable and was worth the amount I paid for. The facilities were very basic but that was sufficient for my stay. As is the case elsewhere in France, free porn is available on your TV and its pretty frustrating because the walls are pretty thin so if you're planning for some naughty action I wouldn't recommend this. All their room were strictly no-smoking so it was a pain because I had to go outside the hotel to smoke. The room tariff included breakfast but the spread is very basic; just some beagles and coffee. Though otherwise coffee was available at the reception through the day for free. There was an issue with car parking as the hotel is right there on the road and they have no facilities to park your vehicle. The hotel is situated in a very busy area I had to go around the block a few times before I got a spot. It is free to park through the night provided you find a spot but your money starts ticking during working hours and its pretty expensive. There's not much to walk and see near the hotel, but there were a few small restaurants nearby if you needed to grab a bite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quite and small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubylondon_England
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo is in a very good location you are a 10-15 minute walk from Printemps and the big department stores and a 5 minute walk from Passage Jouffroy a 19th century arcade with an interesting mixture of individual shops and resturants. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful, the cleanliness is excellent. The rooms are en-suite, very bright and cheerful, but not giantic but what do you need for a 3-4 night stay! My husband and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If not looking for space it is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sandroz
Reviews.Content: A génial! hotel Ok, ok rooms are small but this is not an import parameter for me as I find a unique service. Breakfast, this is the problem I found it barely sufficient for such a lovely place, probably a parisian habit I have never remarked before. Thanks to this hotel i discovered one of the best areas in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable wee hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: GrahamBelfast
Reviews.Content: This is a super budget hotel, I went here with my girlfriend and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is small but very clean and has everything you need for a short break. The location is good - a couple of minutes from the Metro and about 20 from Gare du Nord. It's also just about 20 mins up to Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, excellent price & location...will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: jota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights/5 days at this hotel and were very happy. Excellent location in Montmartre, very close to 2 Metro lines, which in turn will leave you just minutes to the mayor attractions. Also,very to Gare du Nord and you can even walk to Sacre-Coeur, Place du Tertre and Pigale, where you you will find the famous Moulin Rouge. Check out the Chinese Noodle restaurant next to the hotel, and check out the specialty of the house: hand-made noodles. The concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. My wife took breakfast a couple of times, it was the typical french breakfast. Our computer connection worked just fine at the third floor. Our room was very spacious, small cozy bathroom and shower, we did not hear the street noise at all. Nice TV set with only french speaking programs, but who cares.....we didn't go to Paris to watch tv. We recommend this hotel to everyone, not fancy at all but it feels just like you were at home. We definitely will be back....not doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Comfortable Rooms, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six days after Christmas and through New Year's. The rooms are very small, but spotlessly clean and quite cozy. The windows are double-glazed and you do not hear street noise when they are closed. The staff is incredibly helpful, and the breakfast is a good deal at 7 Euros. I had one of the rooms with a shared bathroom and both the toilet and the shower were always spotless. The hotel is also very well located, with lots of shops and bistros nearby, and three Metro stops within walking distance. The only negative is that the room was overheated and to cool things down, you had to open a window, which made things quite noisy. But overall, I would definitely stay here again and this is a real bargain in one of the most expensive cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy, free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: itraveltotravel
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for several nights and am writing this review from their room while on my laptop just before I check out! There is 100% free wireless internet (ask at reception for the code) which you can access in your room - so it's perfect if you want to combine business with sightseeing. The staff are friendly and speak English. I chose a double room with a shared toilet and shower, never had to wait to use either and both were clean. The room I chose was actually quite large by Parisian standards (maybe because it hasn't got a bathroom) - there is room for a desk, open wardrobe, comfy double bed, two bedside tables, phone, a washing basin, luggage rack and safe, and still room to do sit-ups! The safe was deep enough to fit my 15-inch laptop. The room overall was very clean, fresh and tidy. Cons are few. The lift is rickety and gives an almighty jolt as it hits your floor which was disconcerting, and the breakfast is, in my opinion, overpriced so I didn't choose it (there are many restaurants and creperies outside and it's very close to the Blvd Haussmann and several Metro/bus stops). Also, the TV doesn't have English cable channels, but this is no big deal when there's so much to see outside (and free internet). But if you're with kids, don't channel surf at night as you may get a "surprise" - it appears some of the more adult channels are not censored.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DwayneDibley
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this Hotel in December for a getaway with my girlfriend. As most of the other reviews state, the rooms aren't huge, but are perfectly adequate given the price. Rooms were cleaned every day and were well heated. The location isn't too bad- a couple of Metro stations within 5 minutes and the centre of town within walking distance. The staff were universally friendly and can speak sufficient English. The rooms were advertised locally as being 160 Euros per night; the hotel doesn't justify this sort of money. I booked via an intermediary on the internet and paid considerably less as part of a package. At approximately 50 Euros per night, the place is outstanding value. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to a friend and would happily stay there again in the event of my returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for those on a small budget”
Reviews.Author: ae398
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights in a double with shared bathroom. room was small but very clean and cosy. outside bathroom was always clean and i never had to wait to use it. staff speak english and are very helpful. you can leave bags before check-in (3pm) and after check out (12pm). Le Peletier metro is 2mins walk away Hard rock cafe is 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limmon
Reviews.Content: Nice, cheap and conveniently located hotel. The staff were friendly and the rooms while not big were by no means small. The bathroom was a comfortable size and the hotel was clean. I did not eat breakfast there as I would rather get out and about and have my breakfast in one of the many local cafes. It was only a 30 min walk from theLourve and with the Metro station almost by the door you were never far from anywhere. Would definitely recommend it to those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Octofuzz
Reviews.Content: Good location, 5 minutes walk to a Metro station and 30 minute walk to the Louvre. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff friendly. The hotel was maybe a little expensive without breakfast but considering its location its comparitively cheap. My big moan about this was that the bathroom had a clear window that backed onto a buisness, this required various creative ways of blocking up the window to get some privacy when having a shower. Overall however not bad,

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: cybergrrl6
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Hotel Monte Carlo and was very pleased with everything about the hotel. The location is terrific, about a 15-minute walk from Sacre Coeur and around the corner from the Le Peletier metro stop in one direction and a 5-minute walk from the Grand Boulevards stop in the other. My room was clean, though rather small for two, and even though it faced the street, it was remarkably quiet with the window closed. (With the window open, it was noisy.) The staff was great, very friendly, and someone was at the desk at all hours of the day. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I opted for the private shower in room and was glad I did. One additional bonus is that the hotel is only a direct 15-minute walk from Gare du Nord, which is a short train ride away from Charles de Gaulle airport and makes getting into and out of the city easy. Many inexpensive restaurants in the area, as well as the classic bistro Chartier. I'd definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: maria035
Reviews.Content: I choosed this hotel because the previous guests had a good experiance here, and I also wanted to find a place diffent from banal, usual, pale white walls in the room of any ordinary two stars hotel in Paris. Paris is an unforgetable capital and this hotel, named Monte Carlo, is remarkable! To describe it is to repeat again and again the other reviews. For me this place was bright and elegant, very warm and cosy. The theme of the hotel is cats ( they are everythere from entrance to the breakfast room. I suppose the owners adore them.) I brief, It was an absolutely great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved location, staff”
Reviews.Author: blhappypets
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were on a European vacation, and this was our first place without our friends, and on our own with our French (luckily, I speak it, unfortunately, not that well). They staff was so nice (especially the woman at the front desk with the long blonde hair). We had a quiet room (interior, not facing the street). Comfortable room, clean bathroom/shower, maybe this is the norm, but free adult channels? Just an FYI. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby, and we did not have the breakfast there, we ventured out (excellent places nearby). I would return in a heartbeat to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenBristol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it had fab reviews & was within my budget. I spent 4 nights at dream castle hotel (we did the Disney experience) & 2 nights at Monte Carlo hotel visiting the tourist sights. The hotel was very easy to locate from Disney. RER to Auber then metro to Le Pelitier (not sure if spelt that right!) anyway it is pink line. Hotel is on a lovely little street with loads of resturants. The Japanese resturant is great so is Pizza place. We were in room 202 on 2nd floor. I must admit when we entered the room there was a musty smell. I think this is coming from bathroom which had no extractor fan just a small barred window which was left open. We had our own bathroom which had a bath with a shower over it. There was a separate shower cubicle in corner of bathroom but it was not in use. There is a safe in room which is handy & also a lift as well as the stairs. I was expecting 3 single beds but I got what I thought was a double & 2 singles. Actually my bed was 2 singles pushed together. I found this out half way thro night as my beds started to seperate!!!!!!!!!!! but I can't complain as I was expecting 3 singles. The receptionists are great, very friendly indeed. There is a great Hardrock cafe just at end of street. This hotel is so convenient for metro & tourist spots. Great for visiting Louvre & Pompidou centre as both are just a couple of stops on pink line. Hotel stored our bags on our last day as our flight was 9.55pm. I paid 258 euro for 2 nights for 3 people (triple room) not sure if this is bargain but as a single parent I felt very safe travelling alone with my kids. Lastly there is an amazing bakery just down the street which I purchased our breakfast from. Try the apricot pastry thing it is gert lush!!!!!!!!!!!!! I consumed 3 in 2 days!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautifully formed”
Reviews.Author: East-House
Reviews.Content: Nobody should ever expect a Two Star Hotel in Montmartre to be a perfect hotel, but this comes pretty close. The reviews already posted give an accurate description of what to expect. As you approach the hotel, your heart may sink a bit as you spot an Irish looking theme bar (it isn’t) and a busy street - but have faith! The welcome is charming, the small foyer peaceful and there is a ready willingness to store bags and give advice. We had an en-suite room at the back of the hotel and, as everywhere else, it was spotless. The cost was €95 per night for a double room. Having stayed in many Parisian hotels over many years, we did not expect big rooms – the difference was that this had a very comfortable bed and was remarkably quiet. One can always hear something from adjoining rooms in a hotel but, apart from the heavy doors shutting, this was about as quiet as it gets in Paris. Air conditioning would be pleasant but there was a tower fan, which kept us cool enough at night. I have to say that I liked the unusual colour scheme though will not replicate it at home! We did not have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to sit at a street cafe (many to choose from) just yards away. Montmartre is a super base for exploring, and the hotel ideally situated with Le Peletier metro station just around the corner. If you haven’t been before, do go to the Chartier restaurant, just up the road at 7 Rue du Faubourg. Fairly average food, cheap prices, Basil Fawlty service but a terrific atmosphere. Unless we win the lottery, this is where we will be staying next time – and we’ve never said that about a hotel in Paris before!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PVH068
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, its location and the area around! Very convenient and central that means two steps away it is Opera, fashionable shops, tourist buses with crowds of people and nearby I found a quiet street with a french restaurant that serves local food. In the morning I had breakfast in hotel. I would tell that it was a french breakfast like the parians take it every day: croissant of boulangerie, a cup of coffee or chocolate. Not expensive recarding quality and price. The room I occupied was on the second floor giving to the street side. I don't have any complains about noise as I returned to the hotel very late and tired, and I slept very well. The room size was ok, Paris is known for expensive sqare meter and small rooms. In the hotel corridors I saw lots of old paris photos, interesting and funny. The room doors are amazing: big sqares of differnt colours. The hotel elevator impressed me a lot. It was a magnificent big mirrow inside. The elevators in Paris that I saw before were very old, narrow and ugly. The last touch was the entrance doors with brown wooden cats and two little cats in the aquarium with golden fishes in reception hall. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & quirky in a good way :)”
Reviews.Author: nduk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of reviews on Tripadvisor and because it fit my budget. I was not disappointed! I had a room on the top floor facing a courtyard to the rear, which considering it was central Paris was extremely quiet. I make a point of always having earplugs in order to get a good nights sleep - I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't need them once and was able to sleep with the window open. The room I booked had a shared shower and toilet, which I was a bit apprehensive about, but it was really not an issue. The shared facilities were scrupulously clean, and there never seemed to be anyone else using them. The decor of the room was interesting (eclectic perhaps!) but it was very comfortable. As a solo traveller I arrived expecting to be put in a tiny room, but no - it was a decent size with a double bed. The neighbourhood feels very safe, and the hotel is literally steps from the metro (Cadet) and easily walkable from Gare du Nord. Tripadvisor speaks the truth - this hotel is an excellent find!

Reviews.Title: “incredible find”
Reviews.Author: gringaviajera
Reviews.Content: I hate to tell everyone about this hotel because I don`t want it to be full when I go back to Paris, but they deserve this review. We stayed in a room with a bathroom on the third floor. We couldn`t have been happier. The room was airy with good windows(don`t know how hot it would be in the summer since I didn`t see an air conditioner). It was super clean, simple decoration, small, but enough room for us and even had a closet and a safe box. The hotel has the best location...lots of little stores and restaurants close by that are open til late. The staff was friendly and professional, always helpful. This is really the ideal place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that does not resemble to others”
Reviews.Author: ivanoff123
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a 6 night stay in this hotel and we want to share our great experiance with others. Hotel Monte Carlo is geografically in the center and we could reach practically all the nice places by walking. It was a big advantage for us. This hotel is probably not so big like many chain hotels, but it keeps its unique parisian authenticity and charm. We felt that we were the welcome quests and not just one of hundreds tourist couples in Paris. Thomas, the manager, was very helpful and gave us good suggestions to explore Paris and to have a good dinner . We learned also that the hotel has its long interesting history and a french writer lived and created his book in hotel Monte Carlo. We would recommend this place to others, as the hotel is exceptional and Paris is worth while visiting at least once in live. Mrs and Mr Ivanoff

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, look no further!”
Reviews.Author: superEmy
Reviews.Content: We had a great experiance and 5 wonderful days in this hotel. The communication when booking over e-mail was good, easy and quick. We booked a double room / 135 eur for night. The room was comfortable and nicely decorated, adaquate for two of us with good bed , the bathroom was clean too. The staff speak good English and very helpful. Perfect location, 2 subway stations and good restaurants, bars, shops nearby. Conclusion: beautiful hotel, excellant stay and very good value for money! We will definately be going back and recommending it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroFloyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monte Carlo is a welcoming, clean and convenient place to stay for those wanting to enjoy Paris on a budget. Though small, our room was clean and decorated in a contemporary style. It included a televsion, phone and hairdryer. We opted to save money by sharing a shower and toilet with others in stead of ensuit and this worked out well. We also had a basin in the room. The best thing about this hotel was the friendly and helpful staff who made us feel welcome and helped us with directions. It also felt safe and there was no noise from other rooms or from outside. For local places to eat try some bistros off the main street as those tend to be tourist traps and not so good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: thelimopit
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I found this site, and took the time to find a hotel with decent reviews. Hotel Monte Carlo was exceptional. To save money we booked a room without ensuite facilities, which meant we had to share a toilet/shower with other people (not at the same time though). But the room was great, and we didn't seem to be sharing with too many other people. The staff were very friendly and helpful, had good local knowledge and were happy to point us in the right direction. The decor was unique but tasteful, and the room was small but cosy. And the location is utterly perfect, we managed to walk to the Louvre and the Pompidou Centre on day one, and the Eiffel Tower and the Arc d'triomphe on the second day. They were quite long walks, but you get to see the city without walking in any dodgy areas

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Acasto
Reviews.Content: We had a 9 night’s stay in this hotel and we spent a good time there. The location is great with 2 subways within 5 min walking. Lots of restaurants and snack bars nearby. Two steps away you find a small supermarket, open till late at night, a little bit expensive but it could be a solution if you do not have toothpaste. As for the sightseeing, it's great. Opera is at 10 min max by foot, where you can catch a red bus to make a city tour. Till Eiffel Tower and Louvre there is a direct subway line. For shopping it’s impossible to imagine a better place, the famous shopping center La Fayette with its chick, very expensive boutiques or accesible fashion brands ( I mean that in any case you will find something to your taste and your budget) is in front of Opera. Now, about the hotel itself. You can occupy the room from 15:00 but you have the possibility to leave the bags at the reception and see Paris all the day. The room is very clean and morden, decorated in bright colours. In our room we had a flat screen TV with ALL channels free, free safe box, hair dryer and ensuit bathroom. The hotel breakfast that we had every day was not bad with good french croissans. The font desk staff is very helpful, polite, they are always available for any explication and speak good english. We recognize, it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “an affordable find”
Reviews.Author: CanariesPA
Reviews.Content: Given prices and service in Paris, it is nice to report on a nice find suitable for a range of travellers. I stayed for one night in March, traveling alone, and stayed in the cheapest room. I was pleased to find it of adequate size (I've stayed in smaller rooms, esp in London B&Bs, for more money), very clean, and well organized in terms of furniture, etc. It had a sink and the toilet and shower rooms were across the hall. (I'm not sure how many there were on the floor - I didn't have to compete for their use, but in the high season this might be an issue.) These were also very small, but likewise clean. The front desk service was excellent - very welcoming, bi (or probably tri or quad-) lingual, and helpful in giving restaurant etc recommendations. The neighborhood is convenient rather than fashionable, but seems safe enough and has a fair array of restaurants within 2 blocks of the hotel. There are a large # of Asian restaurants in the area, I noticed; and a late night convenience store perhaps 1 block south of the hotel. The nearest Metro stop is only a block away but other lines aren't far; I walked from Gare du Nord, and this was about 20 minutes, a straight line down Rue de Lafayette. I didn't have breakfast, though the price seemed a bit steep for what was on offer and what's available at local boulangeries. All in all, I think this was a very good find at the price, and would recommend it as a nice foothold for a night or two in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: HJ123
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly atmosphere and helpful staff make this the perfect place for business travellers in Paris. I stayed for 2 nights and was very satisfied. I would recommend it to my collegues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: fzemma
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It's quite lovely. Clean and nicely furnished. A great merci to the staff, who were very courteous and helpful at all times. And a special thank-you to the maid who carefully arranged our bed every day! We had a lovely room with a nice bathroom and absolutely no complaints. We would recommend this hotel for it's convenience, location and price. And, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aljung
Reviews.Content: Great location- near few metro station. The rooms are small by American standards but very clean. A short walk from everywhere. Mass transport and shopping are nearby. It was a welcome place to come home to when sightseeing in Paris. I purchased this as a package deal so I didn't pay full price. The hotel had excellent service. Free wi-fi (many nearby hotels charge a LOT extra) I was greeted by name by some staff. I am very likely to return to the Montecarlo Hotel. I would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Avg hotel despite rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: fh1234
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel despite the reviews. The people working at the hotel were friendly. but the rooms were really really small, the bathroom was kind of dirty, with a small shower with a mildew covered shower curtain that hugged you everytime you had a shower. Plus it got really really hot at night with the heat, and you had to open up the windows which faced a dirty little area between the buildings. The hotel serves its purpose if you are out all day and only come back to sleep, which is what we were looking for. My main problem with this hotel was that the bathroom was not clean when we went in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ravina
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel with www.booking.com. We came for a busy weekend break where we were out early in the morning and back late in the evenings. We therefore found the hotel's 24 hour open policy very beneficial. The hotel was clean, the rooms were adequate with a telephone and tv (not a small one), a shower and a toilet. The hotel was very brilliantly located, 2 minutes from a metro. The staff was friendly and spoke fluent English. as we literally just used the hotel for the purposes of somewhere to sleep it would have been more appropriate to get a slightly cheaper accomodation as the hotel was a bit pricey for our purposes. however it was centrally located. we walked to Sacre-course in 30mins through lively streets. on the opposite end we went to the opera house and the academy of music. fairly good shopping within 10 mins of the area by walking. I would recommend this hotel to young couples and anyone who wants to stay somewhere well located.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: Ainol-Razman
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 5 nights in a room with 2 single and a double beds and ensuite bathroom. We paid 150 Euro p/night for the room. The b'fast was 9 Euro per person but kids eat free, which was economical for us. The room was warm but the bathroom rather cold despite the heating. It may be warm in summer as the room had no air-con but the windows are wide. The room was a bit of a squeeze on account of the number of beds. There was a sufficient number of shelves but very little space in the open closet to hang clothing. The safe in the closet was useful. The sheets and towels were clean and decent. The room was cleaned everyday and the towels changed daily. The family running the hotel were friendly and helpful and informative. The hotel is 5 mins walk from the Le Peletier metro and about 15 minutes walk to the Opera house and less than 40 mins walk to Notre Dame. The little rue on which the hotel is located has a variety of budget eating options - mainly North African and Kosher. There is even an Aussie bar close to the hotel! For the price that we paid, I do not think that one can find a better value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers095
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. We were not wrong, it was a very good decision to book a room there! All of the good reviews of the hotel Monte Carlo are correct. It is excellent value, perfect location, and wonderful staff. Our room was ideal. Reasonable size (for Paris) and clean bathroom. Street side room but good double paned windows kept it quiet. Bed was very comfortable. Just what we needed after walking all day long. Free internet connection at the reception. We didn’t bring our lab tab but just nearby of the hotel there is an internet spot. Location, as many have noted, is a real plus. We were able to walk comfortably in any direction. Opera and Galleries La Fayette is a just 5 minite walk to make shopping for Christmas. Absolutely great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kiwikidNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel in an excellent location, close to the Opera Garnier and Grand Boulevards. I stayed here for seven nights in november this year. The hospitality and courtesy from the staff was superb,welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. They put their guests first and it was a home away from home. A very busy noisy street but with the double glazing on the windows, it was no problem. Rooms vary in size so best to inquire which would suit your needs best. Some have ensuite and some without bathroom which is in the hallway. The street has a number of good cafes plus a small night market and the metro Peletier is only a five minute walk away. Thanks to Thomas and his staff, I will definitely stay there again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FMAM
Reviews.Content: I booked this according to the reviews is TA The positive aspects are that the hotel is near restaurants, bakeries and a small supermarket. The staff are very nice and helpful and speak fluent English. Me and my wife stayed in a double + bath and shower. The room was clean with a flat screen. The size of the room was acceptable. It has a heater and a small fan (no AC). The bathroom was also OK, standard nothing special. The things that I disliked, was that first of all the parking is a bit far from the hotel. It costs 27 euros for 24 hours. I stayed in anothe hotel in Paris and the parking lot asked me to stamp the parking ticket from the hotel and charged me 12 euros/24 hrs. The hotel location is a bit far from the Champs and Eiffel, for the same price I can get a hotel 5 min walking to the Champs. The view from the window was to a junkyard in between a couple of buildings. What I really disliked is the channels they were viewing at night. First of all, all the channels were in French, at night 3-4 change to adult channels. I was glad that I didn`t bring the kids with me or else they would of had a room by themselves and might seen this crap. In general, the price I spent (130 euros from Venere) was too much for the room and hotel. It deserves 90-100 euros per night maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and cosy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: il0veparis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few days ago and loved it! The location was excellent, near loads of shops, restaurants, bars and cafes. This hotel is different from many parisian hotels. It is lovely and very friendly. We really enjoyed cosy atmosphere at the hotel: comfy, simply and nicely done room, perfect location (situated very close to the subway) .The owner of the hotel was extremely helpfull and friendly, giving us useful ideas and advices on the places to visit in Paris. The room was exactly like on the photos: clean and with lovely colours. It was not very big but quite enouth for two of us. Now really we advice this place to all our friends. Next time visiting Paris there won’t be a question for us where to stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “OK but I can't see why it has all these rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at the rave reviews this hotel has had. Yes, it was clean and very near a metro stop and the staff were pleasant and friendly (although we hardly saw the same people twice in our three day stay). It was also warm. We had a quiet room that overlooked a dingy courtyard although the walls were very thin leading to the other rooms. But I am afraid I found it quite uncomfortable. The room was very small and oddly shaped, the colour scheme was extraordinary, the woodwork was dark brown the carpet also dark brown, the walls were very dark green or very dark purple so it felt like walking into a gloomy cupboard. The TV only got French channels. The lights were dim and I found it quite hard to read in bed. After dark there was no chance of writing anything at the very narrow desk which was pushed against the far wall, just no lighting there at all. The double bed was 2 narrow singles pushed together, which developed a gap in the middle by the end of the night. We didn't want to spend the evenings there at all and felt a bit banished to the rainy streets! The bathtub was gnome sized, and the floor had a pronounced slope. We didn't try the breakfast as it looked a bit dull but we did find a great boulangerie patisserie just a few steps to the right in rue de Provence. You can sit down and have coffee, fresh orange juice a tartine and a croissant or pain chocolat etc for 6.50 euros there. Beware it was shut weekends! In fact the whole area was a bit dead at weekends. It's a rather workaday area of Paris with a lot of philately shops, a little road of food stores (rue Cadet). It's not too far from the Folies Bergere and some Jewish shops. And also a lovely chocolate shop in rue Provence. But it's not exactly a thrll a minute, nowhere you can sit around really and nothing much to see. I much prefer staying on the left bank. Given that it was a very tiny hotel with odd shaped rooms in a dull street, the owners have done pretty well with it and they have tried to make it individual. I guess what I am saying is that it is not any kind of a boutique hotel if you were expecting it to be and somehow from the photos I thought it would be. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Danna074
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel in a cenral part of Paris, not far from subway and we choosed Hotel Monte Carlo in the Opera area. It was a good choice. No regret, only good things to tell. First of all the hotel is very well located near the opera house, big shopping centers and nice restaurants. Good, quiet room. The heater was hot and there was a lot hot water in shower. Daily room service. A good staff that will help you at any time. It’s open 24 hours. It’s a good quality hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: itsumo_no
Reviews.Content: perfect location, few mins walk to metro with lots of cafes, bars, bakeries etc close by, including a fantastic vegetarian restaurant about 6 doors down on same street (cant remember the name of it noe, though!). very clean rooms(clean beds,sheets,bathroom etc), my room faced a side street and was very quiet. very friendly staff, would highly recommend, the perfect hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: franco037
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel just for 2 days and I would be glad to stay more but I had to leave Paris to continue my business trip. If I tell that my stay was great, the hotel was clean anb breakfast was good, I would just repeat the opinions of others. I would tell thanks to all the hotel staff who cleaned my room, took care of the bags at the reception on my departure and tried to make my stay comfortable and pleasant. I will recommend hotel Monte Carlo to my best friends! Merci!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for New Year’s holiday!”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers90
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband love Paris, this romantic city , and now we have follen in love with hotel Monte Carlo. We have spent a wonderful one week stay there. They welcomed us with smile from the first day. They were eager to help us. The front desk staff speak English and give Paris map. Hotel was very clean and in a good spot. It's 10 minute walk from Opera and 20 minute walk from Montmartre. In the area of hotel there lots of restaurants and bars, small and big shops. The breakfast was very good with a great variety of choice and it is served till 11 a.m.. We loved a lot the hotel decoration: fresh juicy colours make the place expressive and exeptional. In the breakfast hall and reception we saw a lot statue and paintings of cats, I think for cat lovers it’s the ideal place. We hope to be back for New Year’s holiday. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: CanuckTraveller07
Reviews.Content: I've recently returned from a very enjoyable 3-night stay at the Hotel Monte Carlo in Paris. I highly recommend this little gem of a hotel to anyone seeking affordable accommodation, excellent customer service, and a perfectly located base while visiting Paris. I was lucky enough to get a room in the back corner of the top floor of the hotel, so street noise was not an issue at all - extremely quiet. I had a double bed, with no ensuite facilities, for €70 per night. The rooms are quite small (and, unfortunately, not very soundproof) but the size of the room - and the rich, warm colours that the entire hotel is decorated in - only adds to the charm of this hotel. The cat motif is everywhere in the hotel (which I loved); it's a shame the cats are no longer in residence. There was always fresh towels and sheets provided, and a pleasant, fresh scent would prevail after the room had been cleaned. The room itself had everything needed during a visit - telephone, heater, flat-screen TV, in-room sink (with shampoo & shower gel provided), and a safe where you could lock your valuables away and not worry about them being stolen. This is, however, a very safe hotel as is the general area around it. The shared facilities were always fairly busy but the shower & toilet was kept extremely clean; I heard housekeeping cleaning them at various points throughout the day. The bed in my room was incredibly comfortable and you seemed to sink in, yet be firmly supported. The staff at the hotel are very firm about check-in time - they will not allow you to check in prior to 15:00, but if you do arrive early they will hold your luggage at Reception while you explore Paris until check in time. A cold buffet-style breakfast is provided each morning, which is absolutely delicious. I did feel, though, that €9 is a little steep in price but there is a wide variety of food and plenty of it. You can get a cheaper breakfast in the area around the hotel, but it will be Continental. There is a very small lift in the hotel, which is good as the stairs are very steep and winding (just be prepared for the sudden stop of the elevator when it comes to your floor!). For those traveling with laptop computers there is free in-house WiFi, but you need to bring your laptop to the lobby in order to connect. The location of the Hotel Monte Carlo is perfect - many of the main areas/sites of Paris are walkable from the hotel. The hotel is very close to the Grands Boulevards Metro station and is a close walk to Gare du Nord and the Opera, where you can catch the Roissy bus to/from Charles de Galle airport for €8.50. All in all, a great stay at the Hotel Monte Carlo in Paris. The staff are very pleasant and helpful, and Thomas (the owner/manager) always made fantastic efforts to ensure everything was perfect for the duration of my stay. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Dazed and Confused”
Reviews.Author: Anna_von_M
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor and hoping to find a nice budget hotel in Paris for my next visit, I contacted the hotel directly. The rooms were available and I decided to go ahead with the booking. First of all, I was asked to provide my bank card number INCLUDING the security code at the back of the card... I NEVER give out such information, especially at the hotels or small businesses, where chances of fraud are paramount!
