Anybody can access this information which is stored in the hotel's books forever and steal the card information and this happens left, right and center! Without the security code, I was told, the hotel could not take my booking. Well, I regularly make reservations at various hotels all over the world and I was never asked to provide such level of security information. Secondly, the hotel do not accept Visa Debit card. They only accept credit cards. As I do not have credit cards but used my Visa Debit for years all over the world without ANY problem whatsoever, I was extremely surprised as to why Hotel Monte Carlo would not take my Visa as a guarantee of my booking. They did, however, suggest that I could transfer the money via Western Union (no way!) or make an inter-bank transfer which would add at least 20% on top of the total amount. Alternatively, the hotel suggested they take the first night's payment "to see if the card works" but this amount would not be refundable. I live in London and go to Paris regularly, at least once every 2-3 months. I have never had such problems in Paris or ANYWHERE in the world before so this experience is rather confusing. Thankfully, there are many other hotels in Paris which do not give such hassle to their potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Friendly, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler581
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for a few days and would definitely recommend it. The hotel front desk staff spoke very good English and was very, very helpful. Thomas was especially helpful. They gave us great suggestions on what to see and where to eat/drink. The hotel is in a great location and there are alot of restaurants and shops nearby. There is also a little grocery store right across the street to stock up on food and water. There are two metro stations very close to the hotel which was really convenient. The hotel is also about 10-15 minutes by foot from the Louvre. The room is small, but was very clean. Our room also had a bathroom which was small, but nice and clean. You may want to make sure that your room has a bathroom before you book (if that matters to you). The interior walls are a little thin, but not bad. The window to the street blocks out almost all of the street noise, which was very nice. We really didn't have an issue with noise at all. Paris is a great city and we loved it. I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it to a friend!”
Reviews.Author: calderara
Reviews.Content: In Paris there are millions of hotels but to find a good one could be a problem! It was not my first visit to Paris but it was the first time I have stayed in this hotel. Hotel Monte Carlo is a true gem in the heart of Paris. I appreciated best of all a good quality service. My room was nicely done and cleaned daily and the staff at reception speaks english and was very helpful. I ‘ve got a room with shower on the third floor on the street side. It was clean, quiet and the size was adequate for Paris standarts. I don’t have any complains, I had everything I needed: good bed, good pillows and a good service! I had a nice stay and I will return to this hotel. I would recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: etravel2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in September. The staff are lovely, very helpful and the hotel is quite clean. It's well located between a few metro stations (we used the Le Peletier station) with lots of food options around, including 2 fabulous bakeries! The only downside was that we had asked for a quiet room, away from the street. The hotel was happy to arrange this, but we ended up getting a room on the 2nd floor, which had a sloping floor or a slight gradient. We didn't immediately think it would be a problem until we slept on the bed. I felt like I as sleeping head-down all night and subsequently made my partner sleep on my side of the bed for the rest of the trip. I guess we could've changed rooms, but since it didn't bother him, we stayed in there. I'd recommend this place andI was to go back, I'd ask for a room with a flat floor!

Reviews.Title: “If ever in Paris I will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: levitt
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights and completely agree that the hotel discription is true. It was a pleasure. I called the hotel and they made for me the same rate that on internet site. It was a good deal! I was in the hotel very early and tired. A man at reception gave me a cup of hot tea, it was very welcoming. I felt better and I went to see the city. The hotel is very well located, all the places of interest are not far. When back to the hotel the staff were wonderfully friendly, they gave me a Paris map and kept my bags. I don’t speak good french but the staff explained me with patience all the information I needed. Besides a lot of touristic brochures and information is in the lobby stand. My room was on the second floor in a quiet corner. In the room I had a safe box, flat tv, table, hairdryer. It was clean, i liked that there was a lot of hot water, a good pression shower. Daily room service made a good job and did not disturb without need. In the lobby they have free WIFI, so you can use it if you have your labtab. If not , a cybercafe is nearby. I was a nice stay in a nice place. I will recommend this hotel to my friends. If ever in Paris I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shazzy1
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I had a four night stay at this hotel and it was a brilliant find. The staff were really friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived til the day we left. We were a bit concerned having booked a room without bathroom facilities but the shared facilites were immaculate. There is only four floors to the hotel and a max of ten rooms per floor, some of which had their own facilities. We also had maid service every day. Our room faced the back and was very peaceful! Would deff. stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: neuehaff
Reviews.Content: Before booking we have checked the reviews , and agree that this is a good-value well-located hotel for Paris sightseeing. It is situated at the centre of Paris and so you could practically walk to any famous/popular parts of the city. It's less than a 10 minute walk to the Opera house, and 20 minute walk to Louvre. The metro is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for 5 nights and enjoyed a very pleasant and friendly stay. The front desk was very helpful and the atmosphere of the hotel was peaceful. During the stay the staff helped us to book a place at cabare Moulin Rouge, it was a very beautiful show, and on departure they called for us a cab early in the morning. The housekeeping employees and breakfast crew always greeted us with a friendly smile. Speaking of breakfasts, they serve it till 11 in the morning which is very convinient if you like to sleep ( and you would like to sleep till 10 o’clock as the bed and pillows are very comfortable and soft! ) and they have about 5 different kinds of cheeses, boiled eggs, cereals, jam, honey, fruits and bio bread. The coffee was wonderful. The hallways and rooms were always kept clean. Our room was lovely blue and green. A very highly recommended hotel to stay inParis. We 'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: victorylehmann
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed in a hotel in St. Germain des Pres, but this time we decided to change the area and choosed the Monte Carlo after reading the positive opinions and it was a great find! Monte Carlo is a nicely decorated, cosy hotel with a very friendly and efficient staff in a city center and close to three metro stations. We had a double room with ensuite bathroom with good quality shower. Everything was very clean and the room was made every day. The most wondeful thing about our room was the bed! It was so comfortable that every morning I was fresh and ready to enjoy Paris all the day! It was neither hot no cold, the weather was just perfect to explore Paris, so we did not use a fan that was in our room. We loved a lot the elevator with a fantastic mirror. I have never seen such a beautiful elevator! Breakfast was also good – lots of different kinds of tea, chocolate, cofee, fresh fruits, eggs, cornflakes and cheeses , french bread for 9 Euros only! In the evening there is no problem to find a place to dinner, besides the hotel staff can advise you a nice restaurant. There is a little supermarket in front of the hotel that is open till late at night. We would use the hotel again and recommend it to others. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingwardy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a double room with shared bathroom for e65/night. The hotel is nicely decorated in a modern style and looks a lot smarter than I expected from its official rating. Although the room was small it had a sink, flat screen tv and air con. Our shared bathroom was amazingly clean on every occasion. Its really near to a variety of metro stations and even walkable from Gard du Nord. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Alimac04
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel and thought it was excellent. All was really clean, staff friendly and efficient . I arrived expecting to share bathroom but found to my surprise all was ensuite! A lucky break.. Location is really good - within walking distance of Gare St Lazare and Gare du Nord and easy to reach from metro. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice find”
Reviews.Author: bing1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in August. Its situated between 3 metro stations so its pretty easy to reach from wherever you are apart from the airport (CDG) which is slightly trickier. To start with the reception is always staffed and they always greet you when you arrive with a smile. All the staff we met spoke good English and were very helpful. We never ate there at the hotel so I cannot comment on that. The room was a-bit odd and looked as though it had been two rooms some time ago but this wouldn’t be a problem. The bed was nice; a lot of closet space and bath room was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “It took two visits to make a great find.”
Reviews.Author: GandT16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for 3 nights all up, broken in the middle by an out of town stay. Our first room was the one next to the elevator, so it seemed that the room lost space because of this. The decor was very nice and the french doors opened to the front street, which we loved. The bathroom was a let-down. The light above the basin was loose. There were cracked tiles and the shower was so small you were hanging out of the cubicle if you weren't standing ram-rod straight. The shower also leaked at the tap. Having said that, the bed was comfy, there was a TV and a safe inside the wardrobe. What saved it for me was when we returned from our out-of-town stay, we had another room which was pure luxury compared to the first one. Our bathroom was clean, in great order and with a bath. The bedroom was larger too. We felt we'd been given the honeymoon suite, it was that different from the first! So overall, we would return to Hotel Monte Carlo - it's terrific value for money - but we would request any room other than the "elevator" room. Special thanks to Thomas who was extremely helpful throughout our stay and who endured my poor french with aplomb. Thanks also for organising our early a.m. taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Will happily go back”
Reviews.Author: roles
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant 3 day stay. The hotel is within walking distance (quite a long, but interesting walk) of everywhere. The surrounding streets are full of restaurants, patisseries, cash machines and suchlike, but is not as 'touristy' as the Latin quarter. There is a small supermarket just across the road (they are hard to find) and the entertainment provided by the patrons to the karioke asiatique club across the road was priceless. The room was small but adequate and as we have found with most city hotels, is quiet with the window closed. It was warm, so we slept with the window open and the trick is either to wear oneself out during the day so you sleep through anything, or go with the flow and enjoy feeling part of the bustling life of a city that does not sleep until 2 or 3am (when the Karioke closes).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: williamthorn2
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a hotel in Paris that was clean and in a great location and that wasn't ridiculously expensive. I came across the Monte Carlo in Opera area. My initial reservation was for three nights, but decided to extend two more because of the fantastic location and wonderful city. The hotel is within walking distance of Opera, Montmartre, Galeries Lafayettes, close to a subway which could connect you to all parts of city. In the area around the hotel, there were many cafes available for lunches or dinner. The rooms are nice and were kept VERY clean. Good bed, flat tv ( all chanels are free), free safe box, hair dryer, telepnone- I had everything to feel comfortable. The breakfast was tasty and a good start for the day.The entire staff is courteous and entirely helpful. In summation this hotel is ideal. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: ArronHendy
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay again. The hotel is right in the centre, walk to Montmartre, Tour Eiffel or anywhere. The metro is only 50 yards away and will get you everywhere in minutes. The double room was recently decorated and kept spotlessly clean by the friendly staff. Bathroom the same, with a bath. Good breakfast too. The staff will help you with any information you need. It felt great being so close to the grand boulevards, excellent restaurants nearby, as recommended by Thomas the manager. Very sad to leave. Wonderful stay. Go to the corner of Rue de Fauburg Montmarte next to the Grand Boulevards Metro, there is an excellent creperie for a takeaway crepe, the ham cheese and egg one is lush.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: rythmicjane
Reviews.Content: An excellent renovated hotel situated in Paris center, close to Opera, LaFayete and many other attractions. We had a five night stay in hotel Monte Carlo in June and we liked a lot this nice place. Very friendly and helpful staff, all with very good English made our holidays unforgettable. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. I felt I could trust the staff. This was very important because it meant I could relax and not worry about leaving things in the room. We stayed in a standard room which was adequate for two people. Most importantly, the rooms were clean and well maintained. We took a hotel breakfast in the morning, it was very good: lots of coffee and tea, orange juice, french bakery, diffent cheeses, eggs, honney and fruits only for 9 Eur! In a bar neaby just a cup of coffee and a tost costs 6 Eur. I would not want to stay in any other hotel when I return to Paris. It's great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: laylo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 month-old baby and I stayed at the hotel from June 23-25th. We loved the location in Montmartre. There was so much life in the area. There was a cafe every few steps, a grocery store right across the street. There was also an internet place just down the street (they also have 3 phone booths in there for really cheap phone calls long distance!). For those who love to shop, there is a Galleria mall just blocks away! We walked everywhere. We walked to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, and along the Seine River. The furthest was the Eiffel Tower, and we got there in about 1/2 hour - 45 minutes. Thank god for the elevator in the hotel(for our baby stroller and all!). The staff was friendly and helped us with any directions we needed. There were 2 useful maps in the lobby that were perfect for us to find our way around. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast, as we found it at the numerous cafe's around the area. The room itself was sufficient. We had room 403 which was front-facing with 2 big windows that opened up to the street. It was pretty hot when we were there, and wanted to keep the windows open as there was no air-conditioning. However, it was pretty noisy at night, so we used the big fan they provided for us instead. They didn't have a cot for the baby, so she shared the king-size bed with us (it was actually 2 twins pushed together, so we had to watch she didn't fall between!). We opted for our own bathroom, which had a bathtub and shower with great pressure, and never ran out of hot water. To get to the Charles de Gaulle Airport, we took the direct bus from the Opera House which was very close by. It cost 8.50 Euros each, and took about an hour to get there. You just buy your ticket from the bus driver. It stops at each terminal at the airport as well. All in all, the Hotel Monte Carlo suited most of our needs. If we ever make our way back to Paris in the summer though, we may opt for an air-conditioned hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lilysteel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in this hotel in Paris. Located in the 9th Arrondissement, it is convenient to the Metro, Gare du Nord, Gare de l'Est and Paris shopping. A three minute walk to the Cadet Metro station makes it a perfect location for getting around Paris in a hurry. I booked a single room with ensuite bathroom for two nights and paid 95 Euros per night. The typical French Breakfast (bread, cheese, coffee, yogurt, cereal, etc) is not included but is available for an additional 9 euros. Because I was only in Paris for two days, I didn't waste time with breakfast because just around the corner on Rue de Cadet are some of the best boulangers and patisseries in Paris -- where you can buy exquisite pain du chocolat for 1 Euro and the most scrumptous quiches and fruit tartes for a mere 2 Euros each. The hotel is well kept and the staff is very friendly, courteous and eager to please. My room was quite spacious but a bit stuffy upon first entering. No air condition but a fan and windows to open. Paris was very hot and so it was a challenge to make the weather work in my favor while in my room -- but the rain kept both mornings and evenings cool and I was out and about during the heat of the day so I escaped what would have been a very warm room for most of my stay. My room was located facing an inner courtyard which contained the open door to the hotel's kitchen which was a bit noisy at times. Also you could hear anyone else located in rooms facing the courtyard who had their windows open -- these were mostly rooms above and below me -- there was no one across from me so I did not have to worry about anyone looking into my room. Fortunately, by the time I was ready to go to sleep it was quiet. The bed was comfortable, the ensuite bathroom was of a nice size but with shower only -- plenty of towels, clean linens and a safe in the room for valuables. The housekeeping staff does a nice job and they even have a sense of humor -- I had a statue of a horse in my room on which they changed the poses daily! I know this neighborhood and most of Paris very well so I didn't have a great deal of interaction with the staff but they were very accomodating throughout my stay. The neighborhood is safe to walk through day and night but it is a very busy neighborhood with lots of activity on the streets. Both nights I arrived back at the hotel near 10 pm with no problems walking from the metro station. Although I can recommend this hotel to others, it would not be my first choice on my next trip to Paris. Unfortunately, the hotel at which I usually stay was fully booked and I took this one based on its location and the recommendations I read on the [--] website.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller275
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything that people had previously written about it on this website. We loved it. The very friendly staff(english speaking), fantastically clean room, very quiet at night, easy walking to everywhere, lots of restaurants around and mini mart over the road. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this charming gem!!”
Reviews.Author: IHateAirplanes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel as an end to our 2 week UK vacation. We were not disappointed. The staff was very helpful and everyone spoke English. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We did not have the bathroom en suite. The public shower was so clean and so was the public bathroom. I was very impressed with how clean they both were. The hotel is small but it does have an elevator!!!! If you've traveld through Europe any you will know how much of a treasure this is!! The hotel is in a great location, we even walked all the way to Montmartre!! When we go back to Paris we will definitely stay there again. The only disappointment was that the cats no longer stay at the hotel, they are at the owners house now.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to stay at Monte Carlo !”
Reviews.Author: peter522
Reviews.Content: To spend a nice week-end in Paris we booked this charming hotel Monte Carlo. Little jewellery in the heart of the city. My husband booked a double room for 110 Eur per night. It was a pretty room, very clean with the windows to the street. A young man, working at reception was very polite with us and gave us a couple of good advice concerning Paris. In the hotel was also an elevator, I think for the aged travellers like me and my husband it is a great advantage. In the evening my husband had a good idea to go to a music entertainement and the staff helped us to book two places and to call a taxi. We are very grateful to the staff of Monte Carlo for their daily care and help. Highly recommended this nice place!

Reviews.Title: “excellente choice!”
Reviews.Author: friends4
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends choosed the hotel Monte Carlo after reading tripadvisor’s reviews and we were pleased with our choice. We booked 2 double rooms for 4 persons in April and it was a pleasure! Our rooms were clean and colorful with ventilator, a safe, a writing table, TV, private shower and toilette. The staff was very polite and helpful, patient with our terrible spoken french. It was a wonderful weather in Paris and we really enjoyed our week-ends. It’s sure we will stay at the hotel Monte Carlo next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Hotel Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: TripsterUk
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Monte Carlo and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is centrally located in a lively neighbourhood in which I felt very comfortable as a tourist, even taking the metro back to the hotel at very late hours and walking to the hotel. Nearest metro stops are fairly close: Grands Boulevards (green line) and Le Peletier (pink line). Plenty of restaurants and eateries on the street! Very convenient. The room itself was on the 4th floor; it was very small but adequate for the limited time spent in it. Clean towels and bed made daily; reception desk 24 hours; flat screen TV with all channels in French (including a bonus porn channel!). Our room was facing the street and the first night was warm, so we left the windows opened: big mistake! It was very noisy all night long with motorbikes and busses whizzing by! The management was more than happy to give us a back room the next day but we decided to stay in the room and try the windows shut as it had cooled down. Amazingly, it was very quiet! But beware in warmer weather and request back room. We didn't try the breakfast. Reception held our luggage on the last day so we could do our final sight seeing after check out time, which was great. Located close enough to Gare du Nord to walk (once you get your bearings and know where you're going!). Taxi ride from station to hotel was about 6 euros but we did walk it back, which took about 15 minutes lugging a large suitcase on very tired legs. Overall, a very pleasant experience, especially for the money; quite reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “We would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lesked
Reviews.Content: perfect location and great little hotel. Although the room was typically small given it was Paris it was very clean and provided us with a comfortable stay at a reasonable price. £70 per night. The reception staff were both friendly and helpful. Everything you need is literally a few mins walk including the nearest metro stop. Montmartre district is a perfect location for a weekend break. I'd definately recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money !”
Reviews.Author: stathy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from Trip Advisor and based on quality / price, I decided to book it. What a gem! Firstly, the hotel is very central and easy to find. It is located a short walking distance from Paris main attractions. It was just over a 5 minute walk to the Laffaettes galaries and Opera. The hotel staff was good. They helped us make reservations for Moulin Rouge and gave us directions and advice on other sights which was great. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. It is a city hotel, so don't expect massive rooms. Breakfast was great. This really was a full-blown continental breakfast. The woman that runs the breakfast room was very nice. If I ever go back to Paris (which will probably be soon), I'll be staying there again. Really - very, very, happy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: kleins
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel Monte Carlo on the basis of previous Trip Advisor reviews........and were not disappointed. The rooms, although small, were very clean, warm and nicely decorated. The breakfast was also very good and well presented. Very handy for the subway. The staff were equally competent, friendly, and willing to help. All of them spoke good English and we never had a communication problem. They tolerated my attempts at speaking in French. Every request was politely met. And there is staff 24 hours so you don't need to worry about returning by a specific time. This hotel is very nice, great value for the price. On our next visit to Paris we will definitely stay here again. Highly Recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monte Carlo
HotelInfo.Address: 44, Rue Faubourg Montmartre | 9th Arr., 75009 Paris, France
